reviews.review: A interesting stroll. Well it is this big open square space with a small park next to it. Hero Square has these big monumental statues in the center of this big open space. There is also a museum on the left side. What I found really interesting were the statues in the park next to it and this big sculpture that look like it came out of a superman movie.Behind it was a golden bridge that let to a house and church.

Remarkable Square. Take some time to visit this impressionable square to see not only the statues but also the buildings around the square. Do be aware that this can be a raceway for Segway driving tourists so you can get run over. But this is a beautiful sight. Also you can walk into the park behind the square where the zoo is located. We ate lunch in a charming cafe at the right corner off the square.
Visit!. Beautiful and large square perfect for taking photos. Definitely should visit if you are visiting Budapest!

A majestic public space.. We rode the Hop-On, Hop-off bus to Heroes Square, then walked back along Andrassy Avenue. Close to the Heroes Square, the buildings are "Embassy Row", but there are also high-end shops.

Statues are incredible. This is a truly incredible place to look back at the history and people that made Hungary what it is today. Its up near the spas, you need to get the tram to it but its well worth a visit. The statues are really a sight to behold. Hungary does statues so well and some research before you go will help you to understand the significance of this sight.

Not a must see. We stayed in central Budapest and to get here was a considerable journey. It's vast size was impressive as is its significance but if you're only here for a long weekend it eats a fair chunk of time that could be better spent elsewhere

Nice Park. Heroes' Square is part of a big park that includes the thermal baths, a zoo, a couple of museums, and some other sites. The whole area is worth the trip especially on a nice day. Heroes' Square itself is nice for people watching and taking pictures.

Budapest - Hungary - Heroe's Square - Just about the perfect Memorial. This large square is situated adjacent to City Park and is probably a perfect size for gatherings and meetings. It is a major square used in modern day Hungary, and it's history, and offers some superb statues of the seven chieftains of the Magyars as well as the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. It is clean, easily accessible and honestly a delight to visit. Every part is well maintained and clean and tidy and with the thermal baths and park adjacent adds to a great part of the city which is a must visit location. The four hours we spent here and in the castle in the park were great. The area has a lot to offer all visitor likes.
Pretty sight. A must see on your tour around Budapest. The setting is lovely with the statues and the museums on either side.

Fantastic scenery and experience.. As you walk/travel up Andrassy Avenue, Heroes' Square opens up and is immediately impressive. You can almost feel yourself amongst the huge crowds during celebrations and protests. The square sits in front of the huge City Park and depicts the 7 Magyar tribe leaders that together settled in what is now modern day Budapest.

Lovely square. Heroes' Square is a lovely spot to wander around. There is a lively atmosphere and children often climbing as high as they can - which is a nice change from the more static, controlled atmosphere of statues in other parts of hte world.
fantastic. well worth the walk to heroes square with plenty to see as the statues are very good as are the surrounding buildings

Fascinating Hungarian History. This large square is adjacent to one of Budapest's largest parks. It commemorates important historic and is filled with iconic statues . In the center, two soldiers stand perennially on guard over the tomb of the unknown soldier. It is a very affecting sight.

Nothing overly Special but the park and castles behind it make it worth going to see. . Whilst the monuments are no doubt important and special, the square is nothing special. Its a bit further out the city although easy on the metro. The thing that gives it a four is the fact that there is a lovely park and castle walking distance away
Nice monument . It's worth a visit! There is a tourist info point and washrooms nearby as well as a restaurant. It is within walking distance to one of the thermal baths!

Impressive monuments, lots of tourists!. Obviously gets a bit crowded and at times difficult to appreciate without people in your face. But the statues are impressive and the stories behind them worth a little research before you go - it makes your visit much more meaningful as there is no explanation available at the site.

Largest Public Square in Budapest, a MUST SEE. This is the largest public square in Budapest which was created in 1896 to mark the 1,000 anniversary of Hungary's birth. This majestic square is located at the end of Andrassy Avenue. By the sides of the square one can find the Museum of fine Art and the Kunsthalle. This square is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. In the middle of the square there is the Millennium Monument which was done in 1929. At the top of this central pillar there is the Archangel holding the crown and the double cross of Christianity. Behind this central pillar there are two curved colonnades each with six pillars. Between these pillars are the statues of past famous Kings and other important historic figures.
A must see. Statues that are very interesting, but make sure you have someone with you who can explain the history or you won't get the full effect. Great picture-taking opportunities.

A Grand Space. This is a space on the grand scale, commemorating Hungarian heroes in days of yor. Seems to be an essential stop on the tourist route, but easily accessible by subway. Don't just look around the square, but go over the bridge behind and into extensive parkland - great for strolling and watching the good citizens of Budapest relax -- there were Turkish foods on offer when we were there.

Impressive Monuments. This was a huge square. It was crowded with school children & tourists, but there was plenty of space to walk a round & take pictures. The square is flanked by two gorgeous buildings. The Museum of Fine Arts & The Palace of Art. I did not visit them, maybe next time..

Impressive square that needs to be on your must-see list. it's a huge square at the end of Andrassy Avenue and next to the City Park.The Millennium monument was erected to commemorate the 1,000 year old history of the Magyars. The Archangel Gabriel is on top of the Center Pillar, holding the holy crown and the double cross of Christianity. You'll see 7 chieftans, statues of kings and other historical figures.

Scenic Spot!. Heroes Square (Hosok Tere in Hungarian) is a prime place to see the impressive statutes of Hungary's past. Whilst there is nothing to do there, it is simply a nice area to look around and is a useful point to work out directions, since some of the tourist bus companies use it as a Hop-on, Hop-off point. Often, if you walk past Heroes Square, there are national events or unique things taking place all the time. If you want something truly beautiful and spectacular, visit Heroes Square at night, where you can get unique photo opportunities. Regardless, Heroes Square is a fantastic place to spend some time.

Impressive spot!. One of the most breathtaking spots in overall beautiful city of Budapest! Easy to reach by walking from the central part of the city, approaching to the statue slowly leaves you speechless! It's a lot better to visit when the night falls, the lights make it even more beautiful than it already is! History of Hungarian people written on those statues, even if you don't have a clue what was happening in the past, this place will take your breath away. The museums on it's sides surround it, also two beautiful buildings that make the whole scene look bigger and more valuable. Even the majority of historical spots is on Buda side of the city, this one is well worth visiting! Terror house is also close so you can make half a day tour for visiting a couple of lovely spots on the Pest side. Big recommend!

Lovely Square but beware of crooks. The square is truly lovely. Beautiful statues and clean wide space. However, never ever take a taxi from the square. We took one instead of using the metro and got completely scammed. The taxi driver tampered with his meter and as we struggled with our young children, we didn't have time to check the 5000 note he gave us as change carefully. Later we found out that he has given us 5000 Indonesian rupiah! About 50 pence instead of the twenty over quid. Always be on your guard!
Interesting Square. Siezes the mythology and history of Central Europe and central to many attractions. From there you can go to the Hot bathes and to museums and a park
October 23rd 1956. If you know history and you are familiar to what happened in Budapest on October 23rd 1956 you....MUST.....visit this square.

Just a drive by. Despite we only saw it during a bus tour that force by, the expansive square with the omniscient statutes is impressive! It makes you want to hear more about the history of the square - which a bus tour is able to provide.

Large scale statues of famous historical leaders. Hero's Square celebrates Hungarian history on a large scale. The monument which was built originally around 1900 consists of large columns and a series of statues that commemorate Hungarian kings and leaders. The statues', horses' and chariots' monumental sizes dwarf the ordinary visitor. It's impressive and a great spot for pictures. There's not much to do besides walking around and taking pictures though. During the 1989 revolution, large crowds of people gathered here and it was the site of the reburial of Imre Nagy. The day we visited, a demonstration of some kind was expected and the square was filled with police.

A very impressive square!. We visited this square on our final day on our way to the castle near by. It was quite amazing, the shear height alone was fantastic. It was easy to reach and very easy to walk around even thought it's right in the middle of traffic.
Bus tour of Budapest. Really beautiful monument of long ago heroes of Budapest. It was a warm sunny day when our bus driver stopped here and our tour guide gave us a lot of history of this monument.

Interesting historical perspective on Hungary. Glad we walked along the avenue to this point and through the park. We did a self guided tour with Rick Steve's book. I'd recommend it to fellow travelers.
A Must See in Budapest. This a very important Square to the people of Hungary, it has huge sculptures, showing the historic heros of Hungray, we enjoyed this site

Go early before the crowds. On the last day of my trip, I decided to squeeze in a quick visit to the heroes' square after my very early morning bath. It was totally worth it because there were very few people when I got there, which was a little before 9am. And then I saw about 8 large groups coming in as we approached 9 and I was like ok time to go!
beautiful. very impressive square and statues. it is seen from a distance but worth getting closer. a must see monument
Hero square. Fantastic site to see. Lots of great photo opportunities. Also make sure you venture right through so you see the castles like buildings
Lovely square. A must visit when you visit Budapest. Lovely square surrounded by many ancient buildings. Ideal place to take pics.
Good place to visit. We stopped off here on the city bus tour. It was a great place for photographs and given the history behind it it's worth a visit.
another wonderful Landmark. This square is huge and gorgeous. You can see it easiest from the Hop- on Hop-off bus. Get out and walk around and see the sculptures

Amazing Structure.. Heroes' Square was right across from our hotel. It has an incredible history that gives you chills when the guide describes the event that occurred throughout time. A must see when visiting Budapest for the first time.

About what you might expect.. For a tribute area it is pretty large and impressive. It is in a huge square that would hold and I suspect does hold thousands on a busy tourist day. If you are into the history I'm sure you could spend an afternoon there and get a lot out of it. If you are an average tourist it takes about 10/15 minutes to get the idea and on to the next attraction.
Impressive monuments. This area was right across from our hotel (Mirage Medic )-our balcony overlooked the square.Also in this area is a zoo, a castle, a circus. Very nice area

Neat public square. About what you'd expect--large monuments in a grand public space inside a traffic circle. The setting is pretty neat, maybe not quite in the 'majestic' category but cool. Worth stopping by for 20 minutes. Lots of people milling around with selfie sticks.
Impressive memorial. The space is large and nicely marbled on the ground, with a tall column ad statutes of most of the Magyar Kings. A good entryway to the wonderful City Park.

Nice place to view. Nice to view all the monuments and it's a good one to see, it's a bit out of the way so I'd say it's nice to get a bus tour which goes via here, can get some good photos from the bus too.
Wonderful. We went there me & my wife & had a walk around & enjoyed the beauty of history, a great spot for photo shooting.
A must. This is a must to visit. It is so impressive with the large square with a central monument and all the buildings around it.
Stopped during city tour. Large open square with excellent sculptures.....plenty of history....very popular place to visit many buses and tourists.
A must see square. A tribute to the founders of Hungary. Behind it is hero's park which in winter is host to a giant ice rink and of course to the famous baths. Well worth a visit.
An interesting place to see. If you are sightseer, this is an interesting place to see, but you really need a tour guide to explain the statues

Lovely and fun. The heroes sqare is impressive.We visitded here twice (or 3- depends how you look at it).It was the start/end point of the "spar budapest marathon 2016", and the day before we came across it to pick up the marathon kit.So what do we have-A beautiful place, full of gardens, trees, flowers, and a lot of places just to hang out and/or nice for a walk.It ia well located in the city, and all around you can find nice restaurants end bars to hangout.The plus is the story about the heroes square, which you can read about (or look it up on the net)

Remarkable experience. I was lucky enough to visit this place as there was a ceremony being prepared for. My friends and I were able to witness the military in their old style uniforms and the marching of the soldiers. This is obviously a very historical place and it felt nice being part of their country's pride and knowing they overcame such adversity. It felt good to be part and honor the people for what happened here so long ago. There's not a ton to see but still worth spending some time here.

Nice enjoying place. It's totally different a place from castles n churches that we saw during our tour to Eastern Europe. It is a big open place like a war. Memorial where people can assemble and remember there war heros n old glory. It's surrounded by other beautiful buildings like opera house and state natural hospitals.
Wonderful structure . This is a lovely square with some magnificent sculptures on display (Budapest has many, many magnificent bronze sculptures)
It's Square time :). It's really beautiful! We went there with the Hop on Hop off bus, and we had a stop at the square. Took some photos and walked around.
Beautiful and breathtaking . Such a beautiful place to visit. The sculptures are indeed a magnificent work of art. Well worth a visit.
The start and finish point .. This year i joined the 31spar marathon and it was the start point and the finish point of the race , very nice place to visit and to take a photos .
Beutiful in the twilight.. Went there just before dark. There for not many people were there and the twilight made the visit more interesting.

Impressive Square with Famous Hungarian Heroes. Tomb of unknown soldier is surrounded by many of Hungarian's most famous heroes. The grounds are no longer gardens but instead lined with concrete patterns Soviets installed to aide in military salutes.
Nice square in the evening. During the day the square is huge and nice. But in the evening it is beautifully lit. This seems to be the case in Budapest I really enjoyed the city more in the dark.

Impressive . This is a must visit if you are going to Budapest. The statues are powerful and impressive!With no disrespect to the statues, I was a bit upset that there was no "Budapest" sign which I was looking forward to as "instagram" material, of course! There are nice cafes located around this sight so you could easily spend an afternoon soaking up the culture.
Worth a visit. Visited here after we had been to the zoo, lots of tourists around here taking photos and some even sunbathing. Got some nice photos here.

Memories memories of times gone by. Great for taking pictures and understanding the history of this area. I don't know if locals come here, but tourists, for sure, do. Reminiscent of other town acquires in various locations throughout Europe.

Millenium Monument.. We stopped here en route to the Szechenyl Baths. The square is impressive with the Millenium Monument featuring statues of famous Hungarian leaders and politicians on its colonnades.
Wonderful square. Saw this from the top of bus, wonderful large square, easy to imagine all the marching that went on on it. Grounds looked amazing.

Square of Heros. The huge square with many statues was one of the 'must see" tourist spot for visitors. These statues were erected to honour and memorise those heros and rulers in the past while the Stone Tomb in the middle was for those unknown soldiers who died in war. Surrounding this Square were many museums. Although the site was a bit far away from city centre, it was still recommended for others to come during their stay in Budapest

Admire the statues. While this is a tomb for the unknown from WWI, it also is a great history lesson of the founding of Hungary and the Hungarian people. The statues are amazing in their details. The reliefs are incredible in detail as well.

Impressive. The most striking is the Millennial monument - there is a quarter circle colonade to the left and to the right, featuring Hungarian rulers, generals and freedom fighters. At the centre stands a tall 36m column with Archangel Gabriel on top , holding the apostolic double cross and the Holy Crown. It is indeed an awesome sight, seen both during the day and illuminated at night. One can also visit Museum of Fine Arts and the Art Gallery.
Nice place. Nice big square. We were there during Budapest marathon and the place was almost empty. It wasn't so interesting for our daughters.
Lovely. Walked around the stunning monuments and learnt a huge amount about the kings of Budapest and its history. Well worth a visit
Average . A large square with some statues and surrounded by museums. Lots of tourists and that about covers the experience.
Nice. the statues are great and provide a nice visual timeline of Hungarian history. it's a quick stop at the end of Andrassy
Must see. Flag place to visit just in the entrence of city "Forest". The momentum makes well impresion by it size and greatness. The night ilimination is also good.

A Magnificent Plaza. Last stop No. 27 on the Big Bus tour. The day was like the photo warm and sunny, the Square very reminiscent of St Peter’s Square in Rome. The City Park is nearby as well as the Zoo. An outside terrace table in the local cafe for lunch, perfect.

I am sure this is important for Hungarians. Unfortunately, we arrived here on a cold, cloudy, rainy day. It is impressive in scale, but it was not particularly inspiring got us. There were many your groups with guides roaming about, and lots of annoying vendors selling clothes, naps, postcards, etc.

A great monument to history. Heroes' Square is a great square in Budapest that is lovely in that it is this monument only and some museums, not surrounded by retail shops. The Tomb of the Unknown Solder is there, and the monument itself is topped by heroes of Hungarian history and important national leaders. Worthwhile seeing, even though it is a bit outside the city center.
Must see. This area is incredible. You may have seen similar things in London, but this feels so much more authentic and impressive since all of the surrounding buildings are beautiful and old.
great. Unfortunately when we visited they were setting up a horse show so did not get to take many nice pictures up close. But, still worth the visit anyway. Plus it was on our walk to the spa.

Allow about ten minutes for this. This is another one of those so called "must sees" that you need to take with a grain of salt. If it's a featured part of a bus tour then you've wasted your money if you spend too much time there. It's impressive but really it's just a whole bunch of statues surrounded by tourist bus groups and locals trying to flog them overpriced fake hand made stuff. Walk through and enjoy but don't treat it as a final destination.

Great Photo Shoot. This is really a beautiful place for pictures. Everywhere you looks is something to shoot. You could spend a day with museums around the square. The park next to it is also lovely. Bring money for the bathrooms though
Great site in Budapest. This is another magnificent site to visit in Budapest. Grand structures with so much history behind them. Definitely worth a visit.
Must see place. This huge square is worth seeing ...amazing! The enormity of the statues are unbelievable and it's well worth walking around here
Heroes' Square. Must see place in Budapest. Huge square with Heroes monument. We were lucky with a weather, guess its not the same in rainy day. Nice place for walks and photos
Meh . The monument on the square is grand, but I wouldn't go out of the way for it. Behind it is the entrance to a park, which was more interesting to me.
Interesting. Interesting attraction, not a time consuming attractive, worth a view next to the beautiful city park.

Huge square with incredible statues. The square view is full of statues of Hungarian heroes. By walking around I was able to know the name and the years of each one, but needed a guide to show me clearer about the history background of each one. The complexe also has museums, gardens. I was there on the Budapest fest and it was quite fun. Then there is the Szechenyi spa nearby for anyone would like to take a hot bath in Hungarian style. Very recommended.

Dramatic statues. When you come to the square you can see all the magnificent larger than life statues. The whole area is huge but with lovely parks behind it and museum of modern Hungarian art which is worth a visit
Nice place. Good place for tourism and to take photos. Worth visiting for those who are interested in the history of the country.
Lovely cultural attraction.. It was quite a walk from central Budapest to Heroes square, however a very pleasant one! The detail in the statues was brilliant. A must whilst in Budapest.
Impressive. As you approach the roundabout you see the tall column of the angel with Hungarys best surrounding the unknown soldier

Good for photos. I only marked this as average as I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to visit. Yes photo opportunities are good, but really that is it.Might be worth a 5 minute stop if you are intending on visiting the nearby soo.

Interesting History of Hungary. The arches around the center of the square have statutes of various heroes of Hungary dating way way back. there are two museums just off the square and a park just behind it so it is a great place to go to explore.

Heroes for more than a day. Heroes' Square is just amazing and the site of many events at week-ends. Would be a good back-drop for a replay of the song of the same name. There was a fair in the park behind when I was there so very festive.

Very interesting to visit. This site has a lot of history on each statue. To get the full understand of this site, you need a tour guide to really explain it all. I am not sure a book would do it justice.

A grand testament to Hungary's fallen heroes. Easy to combine with a trip to the Vajdahunyad Castle to the North of the city and served by all the Hop On Hop Off buses.It's a very impressive Square awhile Ian deliberately spacious and large to add a aire of grandeur I imagine.There is a centre piece column including some superbly detailed bronze statues of the most famous Heroes.The curved colonnade at the top of the Square then has a number of smaller bronze statues on plinths at the foot of each of the columns.The two chariots and drivers are reminiscent of those on the Brandenburg gate.Overall, very impressive and a fitting testament to Hungary's Heroes.
Spacious meaningful. Went here a couple of times and it was always full of tourists. Wonderful big statues and plenty of room for parades and other special occasions. Worth the look.
Worth seeing!. It's quite a walk from the city centre but it's a pleasant walk, and it's very busy, but worth seeing!
Good to visit. Lots of history, only disappointed as the day before this was all closed off and they were doing horse racing around the square so try and organise your visit to see this

worth the walk there. nearly missed this as we did not realise that quite near the zoo and the spa and could have missed completely if had not made the effort to fit it in - whole area worth a full day really
Just square. Nice place, but not a must if you're short on time. We visited the square since it's on a way to zoo and park, otherwise would probably skip over it
Very busy. We stopped off here after our sight seeing bus dropped us off and lots to see with a nice park behind and also a walk to szechni baths
Really nice place. I see it twice every day and still find it looking good. Museums built with excellent architecture. Good place to take photos.
Worth a quick look. This is adjacent to the City Park. Read up on the history a little, look at and admire, and then move on+
Octoberfest. Again nice to see the crowd over the Heroes Place and part of the city park. Last year was also nice as this year it starts from 1st of October. There is good food and leisure:)

Heroes' Square. Visited Heroes' Square early in the morning before going to the thermal baths, it was nice and quiet. Definitely worth a visit! The area is kept very clean and tidy which is a plus. There isn't much to actually do here but it is an impressive monument which is nearby to many other attractions. Really wish we'd visited at night to see it lit up
Stunning. A stunning location, with amazing statues and architecture, a great piece of history close to the park
average. visited this place with my friend we just hopped off sightseeing bus stop. Was ok nothing special to me but everyone is different.
Stunning at night!. We were living right next to this gem. Stunning with the light at night. People gather here at night and all in all is a must see
Worth a quick stop, not more. The statues are impressive but beyond stopping for a few minutes, I'm not sure what else one would do there.
Interesting sculptures. God place to walk around and gather with friends. Not much to do other than see the sculptures and monuments to previous leaders. Good location to may other things however.
Wonderful entrance to a beautiful park.. There's not really a lot to say about this very grand spectacle, other than it is attractive and makes the entrance to the park quite special.

A Great Landmark!. We hopped off the tour bus to visit the Heroes Square and was not disappointed. It does remind me of Trafalgar Square in London but more open. There were children sat along the statues drawing, possible a class trip and we saw others close by at the Magyar Mezőgazdasági Múzeum, spectacular grounds!

Cool, but not a "Must". We walked to the square from Parliament but we were given bad directions and got turned around many times. We new it would be a long walk and we planned accordingly but became discouraged after multiple wrong turns. We asked for directions several times and struggled to find anyone who was helpful. Every person we encountered pointed us in a different direction and suggested different buses/trams. We walked through some seedy areas.  Once we finally arrived, we were impressed with the scale of the monuments, they were very impressive. We did not find much information in the square describing the monuments so we only stayed a few minutes. We wasted a couple hours getting there for a 10 minute experience.

Heroe's Square. We were in Budapest for 2 days and planned a full itinerary. Travelling by bus or metro is very easy in Budapest. We arrived to Heroe's Square llate in the afternoon, but managed to took in the sights near Heroes Square...a beautiful park close by as well a castle across from the park. Since we went there late, we could not take full advantage of the castle or the park grounds. We will definitely visit again. Would highly recommend.
Yeah its pretty good.. Me and my mate "other" Joe wandered round to this at 3am after the Sparty, Good place but I would say to go during the day because it was pretty dark and we were both hammered.

Interesting. . Visit this lovely park and square dedicate to past important people and kings via the metro line 1 which is the 3rd oldest train in the world. The square I surrounded by a lovely park with a thermal baths and art museum.
Fantastic Statues!. We went out to Heroes Square via the subway. The Square is quite interesting and has some fantastic bronze statuary. The statues are very grand in scale.

The Trafalgar Square of Budapest. I am never one to compare something to another, but this monument was very beautiful and reminded me a lot of Trafalgar square in London. It's something to look at if you're passing through in this area and have five minutes to spare.
A good place to visit. Very accessible by Budapest metro. The statues are amazing and the story they tell. Such a wonderful tribute to Budapest history.

Worth the visit but not exceptional for me. The square is quite big and the statues are impressive , but the area close to the statues was sealed off , so we could not get that close . The castle , lakes and spa's are close by which make the entire area more enjoyable .

Stared in awe....amazing. We were en route to the public baths in the adjacent park and came across this Square. It was amazing to just stand and stare and take it all in and the sheer scale, well worth a visit if in the area.
Nice open area. It was built to celebrate 1000 years of Hungary. There are statues of the 7 key tribes. Large open space in front which is used for recreation.

Nice statues. This spot is one of Budapest's proudest collection of monuments. And as it should be. Every country has their heroes who should be celebrated and remembered of course hero or villain only time will tell. In light of how long these monuments have endured I say all were heroes. I think it is a must see. But on a hot day this square can get hot!

Big square. Walking up Andrassy street towards the square and you see it in the distance and then when you get there it is huge with lovely monuments. The tomb of the unknown soldier is there as well. This is where Pope John Paul took mass on his visit to Budapest. it is a lovely square to visit and see the huge columns

Nice Surprise. Walked up to Heroes' Square at dusk and walked around for quite a while. Such a variety of art and architecture in the area. Walked back significantly after dark and, with so many building lit up, it was an even more beautiful walk. Felt very safe.

Great sights. Heroes square is very touristy but that what you'd expect! The statues are great to look at snd the atmosphere is quite fun on a sunny day. Lots of other things to do in walking distance (we went boating on the lake at the Castle). Nice place!
so what. It's a roundabout with some statues. Perhaps by the stage I got here I was getting a little tired of being told just how heroic hungarians are!

Hungarians remember. I am always impressed with the effort of Hungary to never forget where they have come from. It seems to help them to know where they want to go. Knowing that their land has been paid for by the price of life does not make them ashamed but rather they celebrate this fact and make of their heroes ones to be remembered. It is good to come to such an old country and go home looking at our history through fresh eyes remembering the price that has been paid for us!

its an Entertainment Square !. One of the main landmark of Budapest. Beautiful Square with all the Hungarian statues/heroes.Many activities near .You can go to Hero's Square from the center with Metro 1.
Underwhelming but look if your passing. Underwhelming but look if your passing. There is noting gained by standing and seeing it in real life.
Monuments. Huge square with some impressive monuments. The nearby castle, park and lake are also worth a look. Nice spot for a picnic
A good insight into the history of Hungary. Even though this is a popular site for Tourists, it did not feel crowded. Get there on your own with a tour book and take in the history!

Large Square with Awesome Monument. We did a walking tour of Budpest and one stop was to Heros Square. The Millennium Monument which was completed in 1929 and stands in the middle of the square is the highlight of Heros Square. The monument honors the Magyar tribes which founded the country. A tall central column is topped with a statue of the Archangel Gabriel holding a crown and the double cross of Christianity. At the foot of the column are equestrian statues of the seven Magyar chieftains.

Definitely worth a visit. What time you visit will affect your enjoyment of the square. Weekdays are probably best which is when we went and there was lots of room to wander and take pictures. We found this very interesting with many huge statues of kings, tribe leaders, etc from the founding era of Hungary. All were very impressive. There are also museums on each side of the square and a number of consulates just down the street. Quite a few people will try to sell you books, clothing, souvenirs, etc but a polite no and they leave you alone. An hour is probably plenty of time to see what you want unless the place is packed.
Huge square. This square is on the Yellow metro line. Very easy to get to. The structures on the square are massive and awesome.

Good architecture. Very nice square with monuments showing the history of Hungarian Kingdom and different Heroes! The statues are very well made and the architecture of the square very good. Must see.
Worth a visit!. Large square with impressive statues/monuments. Unfortunately on the day of our visit access was restricted due to works, and preparation for a horse race.
Large square. Large square, nice to combine with a trip to the spa or a stroll in the park! I do advice to do so with nice weather since it's in the open air.

Bit schematic but still very impressive. Monument reminds the 1000 years of Hungarian kingdom. I think Hungarians should be proud both on the historical events displayed but also on the architecture of this place. Just if you are visiting this place in a rainy day or during the summer, do not forget proper clothing, it is nowhere to hide here.

What a shame!!. There is currently roadworks going on result = can't get close enough to see the square, no pictures unless you want some builder in there chugging along. I recommend double checking that all roadworks have stopped before coming here in September 2016.
Under construction . The entire square was under construction during our visit making it impossible to see except from the rear. I wish we could have stood in the center.

A quick introduction to Magyar history and pride. I went here as part of a group, and the tour guide did the explaining of what the monuments meant. There are two large sets of pillars showcasing the ancient kins of Hungary. Then there is a large single pillar, featuring at the bottom, the original Magyars, who formed the Hungarian Kingdom. It's all good sculpture and a must-see, and it doesn't take long. I did think that, for a ex-communist republic, the Hungarians seem to venerate their old Kings quite a lot!
Interesting landmark to visit. All statues resemble heroes from Hungarian history. It is very valuable if you have a tour guide nearby to explain you for each of them.
Impressive Square. Worth a visit. We took the metro there and back from our hotel. From this large square you can then visit Vajdahunyad Castle and view or visit the famous Szechenyi Spa/baths.
Must see. This is little away from other attraction. thi is must see.a big square with monuments of their heros...
Breathtaking . My favourite place in Budapest. Such an amazing and spacious square. Close to the park and an amazing restaurant on the lake which is an ive rink in the winter.Stunning square
amazing. a good place combine of many things to visit: church, music, musem , park, castle , peacful and relaxing
Great to see!. Went to see this not he way to the thermal baths! Great monument to see, although pictures don't do them justice!
A must. What can you say about this area - apart from it's a must. Spotlessly clean there is just something about it that feels special.
Majestic Square. One of the top attractions to see in Budapest. When we were there we saw a march of soldiers during the unknown soldier cremony
Beautiful. This is easy to access on the hop on hop off bus and they give you 15 mins to walk in the square and take photos etc.

Freedom. This square is huge with some interesting monuments, not to mention the museums just off the square. You can take in the power that this area has given back to this country. There is plenty to see and do around the area.
Breathtaking view. Definitely worth a visit. It's quite breath-taking when you come out of the metro. A huge square and lots of places to walk and explore nearby.
Awesome. It is must to see this place and take a picture. it is one of the landmark of Budapest. It is breathtaking.
Very cool.. On the way to the famous Budapest ruin baths we stunbled across this square and it really is big with massive statues atop the pillars.

A must see for visitors.. This is a must see for first time visitors to Budapest. It is easy to get to via the Budapest subway. If nothing else it is a great place to people watch. Beyond is a beautiful city park and the Medievil Museum, and the city baths.
Packed with activities. I visited this place 3 times while in town and all 3 times there was a flurry of activity all around. Not only is it a great memorial, but a great place for public events.
An amazing tribute. Heros' Square is an interesting tribute to those who served Hungary in the ancient past. I as impressed with the individula sculptures and how they were displayed.

Impressive . Really impressive place, the impressive buildings standing tall either side did little to detract from the splendour of the Roman style Columns and statues that stand proudly in the centre
Beautiful area. Found this landmark on the way back from the Budapest thermal baths. The architecture is stunning, worth a visit if you like site seeing
Really nice. . Visited here on a bus tour and also on a walk up the beautiful Andrassy Ave. What a lovely square ...... and so nice to have to remember the heroes all those years ago.

Get your bearings from here. It's a good meeting point for some of the other more interesting sights in BP like the park and palace and the 2 museums on either side of the square. It's also a stone's throw away from Romkocma. Take a quick walk around but apart from a few large monuments there's not much else to see.
Gorgeous Structure. This is a good national monument to walk around and take pictures at. One can walk down the road to the shopping area after this, crossing beautiful houses and buildings.

Statues. The statues are visually impressive however heroes square is quite a distance from the city centre. If venturing out here I would recommend visiting the botanical gardens and the zoo which are in very close proximity.

Must see!. This place is very symbolic of the struggles of these people over centuries against all invaders. Well maintained, on all guided tour lists, and very popular. Very hot on the day we visited but well worth a visit

Interesting monument. Taking the oldest subway line (Line 1) and stepping out in Hosok Tere station is Heroe's Square. It is perhaps an area of Budapest only second in beauty to castle hill. You should have a look and learn the symbolism of the monument, it makes the visit a lot more interesting. There were lots of people doing BMX performances in the area, street performers, artists and more. The city park behind it is a highlight of the city

ON THE GRAND SCALE. A suitably heroically large square dominated by a large column surmounted by a statue of the Archangel Gabriel and seven horse-mounted chieftans to represent the 7 Magyar tribes that settled in Hungary. There’s a further two large colonnades of other heroes. Although an island surrounded by roads, the sheer size means that vehicles are not a problem – once you’ve managed to cross. Varosliget, the large City Park is immediately adjacent.
Nice to see.. Allow maximum half an hour. Lovely to see but not much to do there. The Trafalgar square of Budapest. Xx

Pictures do no justice!. Going around and through this Square is astonishing. You have to see each statue and hear the why We enjoyed the square with beautiful weather and a wonderful history lesson. A must see but also heat!!!!

Stunning architecture . We visited hero square and were amazed by its beauty. The square is dominated by the huge column topped by a statue of The Arc Angel Gabriel. The beauty of this square has to be seen to be believed. A must when in Budapest.

Good stuff nearby. I'll be honest. In my opinion this place is just a square. It has a large tiled court and nifty statues. But if you have been to one of these in other cities, there is nothing overly unique here. However, it is near a lot of stuff and totally worth a visit because of that. The visitors information booth is right across the street. It is between two art museums. One of which is closed for renovation until 2018, but the other appears to be open. There is a park across the street and There are several nice restaraunts inside the park and scatered nearby the lake.There is the hot springs baths, the zoo, and this crazy and amazing castle. So though I did not find the square itself overly impressive. It is worth walking through to get to everything else nearby.

Interesting place with impressive monuments. Came here from metro line 1 which was a nice experience in itself. The square is wide and open with impressive statues and moments. Some good photos to be had too. Its worth spending a good hour here and then move on to the park behind to relax and escape the sun.
Hero Square. Wonderful approach to the square for all to see and enjoy. Large square, very near a lovely park,,circus and zoo. Fine restaurants nearby. Must see as very impressive..

most horrifying and sad attraction. I don't know why, but hungarians are very proud of being a martial nation.All their "heros" were fierce fighters. This dull place is a tribute to this megalomania.Instead of paying homage to this historical abberation, enjoy a ride on the oldest continental subway without a stop at hösök tere and visit the fake castle and spa nearby szechenyi fürdö (next station).
budapest. was a nice square right next to a nice park no seats anywhere though which was a bit strangenice bar on the corner opposite
Wonderful Budapest. So much to see and do in Budapest, I would highly recommend the City. I had a wonderful trip and would definitely consider going back there again.
Good. adjacent tourist office will provide some souvenirs. Few restaurants there. One can also do a boat ride.
Impressive Square. we saw this landmark just by hop on hop off bus passing through it.Large open plaza with multiple monuments and statues. All dedicated to Hungarian historical and mythical figures.

interesting as Nelsons column.. a lovely site, children unfortunately climb over the monuments. situated to a nearby castle and park.The site is easily reached by any of the public transport. cheap and easy to use.

Impressive Square well worth a Visit. The Hop on Bus stops here for a 20 mins photo shoot but it is well worth getting off and exploring the area. The square is fantastic and much more impressive than I thought it would be. Read up about the history first before visiting. Worth walking over bridge and taking in all the sights. Lots of places for a coffee.
Impressive monument. The square and the statues are very large and impressive. From time to time there are sport/food events taking place there. You can also go an visit the nearby park and museum
Very open & pretty.. This attraction is a quick & easy visit. A great photo opportunity along with a beautiful iron fence to view.
Heroes Square. A very big square, near to the bath and castle. Good photo taking spot, especially when there is clear blue sky.
Loved it!. A rly nice spot especially the lakes & gardens right behind it ... this is a must c in the morning !
Huge and impressive. Massive area with great sculptures and brilliant photo oppertunities. Full of history and very grand. Only 5mins stroll from thermal baths

Wonderful Heroes Square!. Must visit! Beautiful Square with all the Hungarian statues/heroes... Some have been changed over the years. Huge and open square. Lots of tourists. Sometimes you can spot BMX'ers or other artists.
Well designed monument. We went past this square on our bus tour. Looked very nice and designed well. Not alot to do in the area!
Big square. This place could be at Rome, Italy - but it is not. The place is interesting if you are a fan od statues, and roman style.

Lovely. Very nice area in the city with a lot of historical sites. You can go to Hero's Square from the centre with Metro 1 which is the oldes and it is takes you back in time. On the Square you see a lots of statues plus 2 beautiful Museums as well.
Good to walk around. It is close to a park and the thermal baths, and easily accessible but metro. Worth walk around and take some pics when coming or going to Szechenyi.

Great place to visit.. You should try to visit it in the morning because it gets very crowded during the day.
The park right behind it is worth a visit too!

Open Air Square & Monument. The weather was a bit overcast the day we visited so it wasn't as hot as it could have been. The area is nicely open a lot of statues are there though you have to get past the column statue to start seeing the dozens more all around.

Largest Public Square in Budapest. Heroes Square also known as Hosok Tere can be best reached by a Hop On Hop Off Bus and its main attraction is Millennium Monument which stands tall in its center. Laze and walk in the Park around it and wonder at the marvelous Monuments built several decades ago.

The biggest square I've visited . This square has a great history and after reading a few reviews, I agree that before you go, you should read up on the fallen heroes of the city that these statues depict to get a sense of what the square means. It's a great photo opportunity and close to a park where there is a nice playground for kids. I felt at times that the rowdy Hen and Stag parties that end their beer bike tours in Heroes Square ruined the ambience slightly...

Don't miss this . Many list Heroes Square and the surrounding park as an afterthought on Budapest itineraries, but we were so pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. The square dwarfs you amidst an amazing colonnade of Hungarian leaders statues and if you wander to through the park you will find so many picturesque little spots to sit and enjoy a picnic and photo ops. At the top of the hill there is also one of the biggest bathhouses in the city so bring your swimming gear!
Definitely worth seeing. This is a block-square war memorial for Budapest. it is impressive and well-maintained. I recommend seeing it if you are in Budapest.

Imposing. A grand square with monuments to the heroes of the nation, those who fought in wars, and also those who contributed through their work in peacetime. the tall central column and the curving colonnade display many impressive statues. On one side of the square is the Museum of Fine Arts, unfortunately shut for restoration, and opposite it is the Museum of Modern Art, which has a jolly little café in its front portico.
Amazing. Beautiful site before going into city park. Well worth the bus ride from the hotel on the Hop on Hop off bus.

Wonderful. When you approach this place it has an impact on you .The story behind it was awesome and the statues awesome.This is truly worth a visit and while looking at it check out the castle in the background on the top right We loved it

Quite spectacular . This attraction is right beside a metro station so it's very accessible, and is also flanked by two museums. Might be better to go around sunset or early evening if the weather is very hot, as there's practically no shelter. The monuments, like most in Budapest, are large and impressive in scale. Worth a half hour photo stop.

Really beautiful. Heroes' Square is a stop on the Hop on Hop off tour, this ensures that you get a bit of information about the Square from the tour. I would have liked to have found out more about the Square as it seems really interesting. Very pretty.

So much history . It is very pretty in itself but it is best to read up on Hungarian history to fully appreciate the artwork. Basically if you have Wikipedia open you can tell a great story from the monuments.
Archangel Gabriel. Wonderful bronze crescent reenactment of the conquest of the Carpathian Basin, centred around a column with the Archangel Gabriel, simply stunning monument !!

A place for capturing your moments in Budapest, for sure. This place is certainly fascinating for me. I heard that this was where Michael Jackson shot one of his music videos. Lots of angles for taking photos.

Magnificent . It's a square with amazing huge statue, close to the city park and Hosek tere Metro station. Nice place to spend a peaceful walk. Didn't get much information as to why this square was built but certainly worth the visit. The beer bikes starts here.

Beautiful Square. It is nice to walk through the square and look at all the beautiful statues. Definitely more meaningful if you have a guide to tell you about the significance of the statues and the history of the square. We walked through on our way to City Park.

Nice place. This was a nice stop on our tour; very clean, not very crowded. We didn't learn much about what it is exactly. But we do know it is a starting/stopping point for the beer bikes! They are abundant here!

Beautiful spot to take pictures! Beautiful!. A beautiful huge square to snap many pictures. You are very close to some of the famous spas and a castle with a big park. Tourist info building is just behind the square. All the hop off/on bus tours go here too. Get out and explore this whole area.

Impressive!. Wanted to take a quick look at this place and wasn't disappointed. Arrived by metro and as we came up from underground the view was spectacular! Huge area with massive statues and a real sense of history. I'd love to come again when they do the horse race around the square, that would be a fantastic sight!

Impressive. Impressive. Well sort of. Main thing that bothered me was that they appear to train the visitors who use those 2 wheeled things to get around on there and one girl actually ran me down.Looks to beva good gathering spot. Not a must see but certainly worth a look in my book.
Magnificent. There is a lovely view of Budapest from this beautiful attraction. It is well worth the bus trip up to the top of the mountain to view the church and views.
Great square . Square steep in history . The states are very ornate and commanding. A great place to wander around . Sculptures life sized and very life like.

Visit with a Guide or Detailed Guidebook. The place in and of itself is a great photo opportunity and neat place to visit. However visiting with a guide can fill you in on all the "heroes" depicted within the statues, their defining moments in history and their significance to Hungarian history.

Clean and imposing. Very impressive area with huge and clean memorials to past Hungarians. Too far out of centre to walk but worth seeing, especially if you approach via Andrassy Avenue with its beautiful buildings.
Great monument in a large open square. We saw this as part of a walking tour. It's wonderful seen from either side. Definitely walk through and stop to take a look.
Pompous . Nice and pompous square with a very impressing monument. It is the "heart" of the city featuring the history of Hungary.
Fabulous and Historic Spot. This vital square is a stunning example of Budapest's pride and passion. The vast space is humming with tourists, but is not too overrun.

Cool but not amazing. This square and the park are pretty far from downtown so it's a trip to get up there. Honestly if you have the time go see it, but if you only have a day or two there are other more interesting things to see and do.
Beautiful!. Historical symbol of Budapest, really beautiful touching, and also full of history. The weather wasn't so nice, but it was still beautiful

Millenial monument on a well structured "square". To me, the nicest squares are not really rectangular, and this is no exception. The area is more a rectangle plus a semi-circle. I believe, the view of the Heroes' Square would be from a balloon at the end of the Andrassy street, but this is generally not an option. Staying at the ground level, the best view remains from the end of the Andrassy street, from where you can see the monument celebrating the 1000th anniversary of the Hungarian state (in front), the building of the Museum of Fine Arts (under reconstruction, on the left) and the Mucsarnok (Kunsthalle, Art Gallery, on the right), and you do not see the contrasting buildings at the end of the street. Proceeding forward, you reach a nice park (Varosliget) with an artificial pond (good for rowing in Summer and ice-skating in Winter), the Vajdahunyad Castle, and the Budapest Zoo - really worth a visit.
Fascinating. We visited with a guide which was ideal. At least have a good guide book to explain the wonderful statues.
Attraction of Budapest. One of the attraction of Budapest. Do not stay here for more time. Take photograph from various angle and structures. 1 hour is more than sufficient here.
A popular place. It will remind you of similar places but it is now part of the history of Hungary with its Kings. It is a magnificent setting.
Beautiful Square in front of a great park.. This beutiful Square marks the entrance to an incredible park. Sooo many cities need a park like this one.
Stunning!. This city has so much to offer and show but you must go and see hero square! The square has been home to some concerts including Elton John recently!

Large square worth visiting. Very large square dedicated to the 7tribes who founded the country. There is some great architecture in the surrounding buildings. Great place for a photo op. The park is massive and a wonderful place for a walk or run.

So many things to see and do but this is a beautiful square to see. Take the Metro right to this place. Try for a wee bit earlier in the morning or late in the day as it can get really busy, especially at weekends. Worth the visit just to see all of this fantastic piece of architectural wonder, let alone the significance of all the statues. Read up about the history and then view it all and take it all in your stride.
Most Impressive - Great Photo Op. If you want a sense of the Hungarian people, this national landmark is a great place to start.Easily accessible by bus. No admission cost.Great photo op!
Grand. Budapest answer to Trafalgar Square (London). Big grand open square with statues. Focal point for a peaceful demonstration when we saw it.

Nice area to visit. Although the monument/statues are impressive the square is a large space in which nothing much was happening. However, it is located close to the thermal baths and a large park which are both worth visiting so I would recommend including Heroes Square as part of a wider trip.

Must Visit List. The Hungarians or Magyars worship their heroes, kings, freedom fighters, unknown fallen soldiers and this is clearly displayed at the Heroes Square. As much as they claim that they are not as religious as their neighbors, one cant help sighting Angel Gabriel right at the top as the Guardian Angel of Budapest. There are museums in close proximity to the square as well as the zoo. Allocate a full day to spend in this area as there is much to cover... And you can also have an insight into Hungary's history right here!
Nice space. A very nice place to go, lots of space and a very nice memorials. No crowds when we went so it was nice to just look at the huge memorial

Nothing particularly exciting . Large open plaza with multiple monuments and statues. All dedicated to Hungarian historical and mythical figures.
Not like Trafalgar Square with performers or artists. Just a big open space.
long walk from the centre but nice to see. since we were going to the baths in that area was not out of the way for us, it's a nice big square woth seeing...

Impressive square. This square is located at the end of Andrassy Avenue and it is really impressive. The problem with it is that after admiring for 10 minutes that is pretty much it, you are ready to move on. I recommend visiting a near by Zoo along side Heroes' Square.
Mrs. This is a very peaceful place to visit. The architect is fantastic. Great for taking photographs and I was amazed at how big it was . A place definitely to visit .
Interesting attempt at history summary. By looking at the people selected as heroes, one can get an interesting understanding of Hungarian history.
Great place for a wander round. We got one of the many beer buses from here and went for a leisurely cycle round the square whilst drinking beer and listening to loud music; great place

Massive. There are plenty statues and relief in the area, very intricate, it had some writings, but we couldn't read it (I guess some tour guides would be nice at this point). Overall, a really nice area, with good transport links.
Outstanding square. This is truly an outstanding square, it is breathtaking, busy with tourists, nice place to sit and take it all and relax in the sun

Big Open Square. This was one of my first sights in Budapest, and I thought it was great. Until I started visiting more sites in Budapest and realised it is basically a big open square with a single needle and a few statues. Other attractions are better.

Worth a look for the statues. Enjoyed this place for it Austro-Hungarian etc statues. It's a huge square and grandiose statues everywhere. Worth a walk out to see it and beautiful park right beside it.

Large Square. While the SquareIs large and has some significantStatues, you really need to bring a good guide book to understand the significance of the men depicted. We had a guide who gave us the history of the men who helpedShape Hungary, and some recentEvents that have given the SquareMore uses. The main museumOn the Square is closed forRenovation. There is another that has revolving exhibits ofContemporary artists
a place to see..... no more than 30 min is what you need here, take some pictures and walk down to the bath house. there are 2 museums right across from one another. good for pictures

Relaxing ground with rich history. This is a park with monument. It has numerous restaurants and cafes. The zoo is directly across the street. There's lots of people sun bathing very relaxing and and relaxing on the lawn.
lovely place. This is a great place to visit, we also went to the hot spa lovely day out on a hot sunny day, we got the bus tour there and underground back
It's ok. Nothing special in my opinion. Come across this when heading to the zoo with the children. Nice big open space with good statues.

Breathtaking Views. Walking along Andrassy Street, you're lead up to a sprawling place, with two curved walls filled with statues and a large column in the center.The closer you get the more impressed you become with the detailed depictions of Hungarian heroes. It was a very awe inspiring piece of architecture and history.

So pretty!. This is at the entrance to the park if you want to go to a museum or Szechenyi thermal spa! It is a lovely tribute. I wish there were more information in english available, but no matter, still stunning to look at!
AWESOME. My hotel was located close to it so I see it every time when I walk around.many tourist there making pictures

Lovely Night Time Attraction. This is best visited during night time. It has statues of the brave war heros of the country. You can walk to this attraction or use the tram or bus service in Budapest. Public Transport including metro is well connected in Budapest.

Walk around square before you head to nearby museums, Vaj castle or Szensi baths. Right off the subway stop, you can't miss it. I believe it celebrates heroes but I did not see any placards so I'll do some research. People were climbing on the main one with out issue. Right near the Vaj castle and large park

Just for a photo op. Its a beautiful square no doubt with some really breath taking statue figures and its a really big sqaure which has gardens nearby and also a museum. But I wasnt too impressed as it was quite dull compared to European squares which has fountains,shops,cafes around it which this square lacks
Heroes' Square. The square is quite large. Has many statues to see. Very impressive. Recommend taking the time to see it.

It's a big square. Not much to say but impressive monuments and a big open space! Must see. The big bus tour (other tour busses are available) starts near the square, so a good place to start your day.
Nice statues. Nice to walk around, but nothing spectacular. you will need comfortable walking shoes to stroll this area which is quite extensive.
Fantastic. Beautiful place with stunning statues. At night the lighting truly shows off the beauty of the sculptures - a must see if you are visiting this stunning city

Massive ,Impressive, Cool..... It's a nice walk down Andrassy to the square... There are some beautiful building along the way and plenty of cafes etc to visit for a drink or coffee... The square and the statues of the horsemen are very impressive.. Then check out the palace across the street....Beautiful....

Pretty, good way to know where you are . Pretty square. Huge statues. Fun to take a picture with/on the statues. Good meeting/navigation point, as the park is close as are the baths and "Retro Metro." There's a tourist information center nearby, too, with English speaking attendants who can help you out.

Nice square. You will find the Hosok Tere (Heroe's Square) at the end of the Andrassy Avenue. Metro line M1 will take you there. It is a huge square with an interesting statue. For me the best part is the park just behind it. A great place for walk and leisure both for adults and kids. Szechenyi baths, the zoo and museums are close to this square.
Hot :-). Great huge place about Hungarian kings and heroes. Not too busy place. You can easily reached Andrássy street from here and the metro line 1 wich is awesome.

Worth a visit. You can reach Heros square if you walk along Andrassy Utca or by Metro M1 Hosok Ter station.
It is a nice square to walk around. It is also very close to Szechenyi Bath. So, if you are planning to go to the Bath you can do it on the way.
Heroes' Square. Right at the end of Andrassy Blvd (the Champs Elysees of Budapest) is a beautiful square with great statues depicting the history of Hungary.

Impressive tribute to history. The square is grand. The statues and sculptures are regal, impressive tributes to those who, at various times, made Hungary great. It helps to have a guide book, otherwise the statues are not so meaningful. What is also nice about the Square is that it leads to a remarkably beautiful park.

This is a majestic square with great roman architecture & sculptures of the kings. It is a great site to visit and understand the history. The size and majestic architecture just takes your breath away! The open space and walk way around is a place for tourists to click their snaps for lasting memories!
Most visited place in Budapest . With sculptures of the Hungarian chieftains and other important people the Hösök tere is free to visit and one of the most visited places in Budapest

Worth visiting. Budapest is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. You must walk along the river at night, it was beautiful and safe. The park has a sort of hippie like restaurant with a large bar. The food was okay, but the atmosphere made it worth the stop.
Amazing. An awesome place to visit. Huge big square with many monuments. Biggest square in Budapest and close to museums and the millennium underground.

Impressive and a must see to appreciate the history of Hungary. Beautiful square with all the statutes of the national heroes dating back to the year 997, when St.Istvan brought christianity to Hungary.
amazing statues. Worth a visit the statues and sculptures are amazing to see and it's adjacent to the spa. God photo spot

Lovely Square with beautiful park behind it. Very nice location conveniently located by bus or metro. The square itself is very pretty and reminds one a bit about the vatican square. The park behind it is also lovely with some boating activities. When we had gone there were also people selling candy floss and corn on the cob so was really nice to sit out and snack in the park.

Visited via Tuk Tuk tour. When the sun is shining down upon Heroes' Square, this place is wonderful. It's packed with Hungarian history if you take the time to read all the information and it is set in front of a beautiful backdrop of the city.Funny fact from the Tuk Tuk driver: the Chinese have copied Heroes' Square like for like, similar to many other landmarks across the world.
History of Hungary!. These lifesize statues tell the history of Hungary. A great photo op. Interesting to see the details of each statue .

Bit out of the way. I had read about this square, so we walked from the centre - a long walk! When we arrived there wasn't much to see. Certainly it was a huge square and of historical importance, but as a tourist attraction, I would visit the other attractions first.
A must see. Take your camera and see this square. History of the 7 most important kings of Hungary. Perhaps you can research in advance so that you know what you are looking at while you are there.

Impressive. It's a beautiful monument- I drove by at night and returned to see it again by day. It's just one of the iconic squares you have to see. Quite close to the metro station, so it's a quick hop off and on again.
Beautiful at night. This place really looks spectacular lit up in the evening time. It's a lot quieter than during the day and a really lovely place to visit.
Large and Grand. An impressively large and grand square like most things in Budapest. The Hungarians seem to have embraced the bigger is better concept and raised it to a higher standard.
Nice square. A big square with a lot of people. Gives a feeling of being in Dresden main square. Beautiful architecture

Seven founding tribes Hungary. A long walk across Andrassy Avenue to get to this place, that certainly not all worthwhile, if done on foot. It is next to a nice park, where after the walk, will be able to drink and relax.Surrounded by two important buildings, monument with statues of the seven leaders of the founding tribes of Hungary

Hire a guide.. Free walking tours are available. Pay the guide what you think it is worth. I would suggest $10. This place is very special to all Hungarians. Each statue tells a different chapter in the life of Hungary. This is also the site for massive events. As many as 400,000 people can fill the square. There is no cover if this is a rainy and wingy day. But, it is free to the public. Learning about their heroes will tell you much about Hungarian values. A god guide can walk you through the basics in less than abhor.
Research before you go. lots of statues, you do need to get a book or research who the statues are of before you go. Nothing else happening here, no street artists, just traffic

Beautiful Monument. Not only there hero's square is an amazing monument but it is also surrounded by some of the most interesting parts of budapest! The monument itself carries a lot of importance and meaning to Hungarian Legacy and history!
It's okay. Its not something I would travel a long way to see, it's beautiful though. However, if you are interested in some of the history it's okay.

Awe inspiring . The grandeur and beauty of this huge monument is, as my title says, awe inspiring. Hungarians have endured so much over the centuries and they are such a proud people. This entire square, with its statues, ornamentation, and the story behind its being is amazing. Be aware that there will be people trying to sell you booklets, shirts, pictures, etc. I would recommend purchasing items of this nature elsewhere.

Amazing. Very relaxing place to be. It is very close to the zoo,to a park. There is also a lake that is used for skating in the winter time. Very close to the luxurious shopping street in the city. There is a bus station for tourists, the side seeing bus tour starts right there.

So majestic. The monument is awesome and beautifully located at the end of Andrassy ut. You ca. Even walk to it comfortably from the Opera House and when arrive you'll be amazed at the beauty.History is all over the statues which have been beautifully cleaned.The park beyond is also relaxing and lovely.
Heroes' Square . Next to the Parliament building and the Danube. Worth seeing the monuments. Great access. Good place to take a break and relax.

A Wonderfully Rich and Difficult History. We had a wonderful guide thanks to Jayway Travel and we spent quite a bit of time here learning about Hungary's history. A mix of fable and reality, these statues are incredibly detailed and fascinating.

Worth visiting.... ...and hides the most beautiful thing I've ever seen. Easy access by yellow metro line, best to visit before 9:00 when groups of tourists are still on their way. Make sure that you go and see that amazing castle hidden in the park behind the square.
The Beginning. Great memorial that honors the individuals that developed the beginning of Hungary. Great place to take a picture.

Nice . The square was really beautiful. At night the statues were spotlit which gave a really dramatic effect. The square was massive which made it very awe-inspiring. Enough space for a midnight dance

After the baths, walk here at Sunset. After the day at Szechenyi Baths and Pool, walk through the park to Heroes Square at sunset. The light will eventually turn on. Its a stunning, picturesque square. Afterwards we went and got pizza at Local Korner, which was a couple easy stops on the metro.
Photo Op. Great for a photo, however is along side a busy street and not around much else. If you stumble here, great, if not, it's probably because you are viewing much more beautiful places!

Relatively Clean, Impressive Structures. Naturally this sight attracts a lot of tourists, which isn't a bad thing because the square and the park are big enough for many people. It's easy to get to and it's an impressive bit of architecture for your photo albums.There is also a bar on wheels that you can book in advance to cycle around the heroes square whilst drinking a beer!

Just a walk in the park... We walked through hero's square as we entered the park on St stephens day . A lot of people just sit around on the square it was for us just a passing place with the lovely grounds around it

Manly, mustached heroes. We enjoyed a quick stop through here. There was a lot of tourists, but it didn't feel crowded. We enjoyed viewing the ring of statues that go along the outside, trying to pronounce the names, and observing the mustache heroes of Hungary's past.
Stunning, a great tribute. Easy to find on main tree lined street, lovely photo op and well lit at night. Combine with a cruise along the Danube or a drink in many of the hip bars

Beautiful statues of figures throughout history. Our guide provided a great summary of each of the figures and the role they played in Hungarian history. There were many other groups but the area is so large we didn't feel crowded at all. Groups stayed together nicely.
Impressive!. Really impressive and breathtaking you must go and walk around the monument! Some trivia...Did you know that Michael Jacksons filmed his music video 'History' on Heroes square!

Quite a sight!. Great monuments, a real must see! After a good look at all the heroes and a few snaps, enjoy a picnic or walk through the park just behind it, or enjoy a paddle boat ride! Picturesque at sunset, but also at any time of the day really.

Hosok Tere. We caught the train from Deak Ferenc Ter to Heroes Square ( Hosok Tere). It is one of the major squares in Budapest, featuring the statues of the seven chieftains of the Magyars and other important national leaders.. There are also museums, a zoo and cafe in City Park, across the road from Hosok Tere..

Interesting square to walk across. Beautiful monument and worth walking past it. Good to have a guide book that tells you a bit about each of the Heroes standing there in bronze. Gives you a sense of the history of Hungary, Easy to reach via the metro line #1.

See it with a guide -- or at least a guidebook. This is an outdoor area with statues of important figures in Hungarian history. We visited by segway -- and our private segway tour guide did a wonderful job of explaining the most important statues and monuments. I don't think we would have enjoyed visiting this landmark on our own. The park beyond the square is lovely -- and was made for segway travel!

Historical place. A stop for all who joined a tour to get to know the history of the city. Reminds me of Trafalgar Square in London or the Piazza in Rome; pretty much anywhere else in Europe set up to remember the past...
Stunning. Large open space with the status looked amazing , the only bad thing i could say is that it was out of the way for transport and can be quite empty.

Great statues. We didn't realise before we arrived that this attraction is literally a square with statues on it! Don't get me wrong they're amazing statues but we were expecting more. There is a zoo near by which is fantastic and two museums either side of the square but we didn't visit these ourselves.

Interesting stop, made better with a guide. Heroes Square is a large, open plaza with monuments/statues commemorating three distinct groups: the leaders of the founding tribes of Hungary, famous leaders of Hungary; and the Hungarian monument to the unknown soldier. It was definitely worthwhile to visit the square with a guide. Our guide made this much more than a collection of statues by explaining a bit of Hungarian history and the significance of the various men commemorated in the statues. Just beyond the square is a nice park with lakes and reconstructions of historical buildings in Hungary and Transylvania.

A monent for the past. The square stands as a memorial for the beginning of the Hungarian nation. Beginning with the seven chieftains lead by Arpad, to King Stephen and all great leaders and scholars. I've visited the plaza the second time and every time I get fascinated by the story the monument is telling.

WOW - great area. The square is vast in area and so much to see. Wander around with amazement. Nearby there is a great park area where you can hire little boats on the lake. The Zoo is not too far away either. Give yourself some quality time to do justice. But, if the weather is hot, you will need sun tan lotion, a hat or umbrella as well as water to prevent dehydration. Summed up: impressive!
Lovely Park as well next to . Here is a lovely square where you can also take a load of pictures and a lovely park next door where you can get a bit of lunch and also sit in the sun in the park.
Good stop when you'r going to the therms. When going to the therms you should really consider stopping here. Its possible to climb up to the monument.
Impressive Square. On a tourbus, the guide explained the origin of this big square. I like the spaciousness and architecture of the square, stunning on a sunny day.

Afternoon visit . This is quite a nice place to visit while in this part of the city. The plaza is very large and the statues are all nicely detailed.
It is quite hot on a sunny day with no shade around so bring sunscreen if you plan on spending much time here.

One of the most beautiful places in Budapest. Okay, so it's a big call to say it's one of the most beautiful places, as Budapest has many beautiful spots. We went at night, and didn't have enough to come back in the day. In one word, Heroes' Square was breathtaking. At first we were foolish enough to think just the statues in the square were all there was to see - they're gorgeous, BUT - don't shortchange yourself, go for a walk behind the monument in the middle, and you'll see a real life Disney Castle! Over the Bridge the sights are beyond anything we expected. Seriously, this one is not to be missed. Go in the late afternoon so you can see it in the day and in the nigh, all lit up and magical.
Viking Danube River Cruise. Hero's Square is beautiful. There are immense bronze statues and gorgeous museums on either side. Go with a guide to learn about all the history of this part of Budapest
Cool to see. This a cool place to see and has some historical significance but I highly recommend going to this location at night as you can really see the beauty of the states with the lights,

A must see stop.. There is more to see here than just the square. Across the bridge is other places of interest and a park. What your pocket there are always loots of people around. If you are in a grroup they see if anyone or unknown couple is tagging on could be a pickpocket.
Beautiful. A fabulous and breathtaking square. Lots to do and see. Museums and galleries are aplenty. Very interesting.

Beautiful square, all the history. We had an 8 hour tour and this lovely square was included. Best to explain and understand hungarian history is there. All the statues are in chronological order and right from the beginning until recent times, all what is there can be easily explained and understood. Recommend to visit either inlcuded in a city tour or to visit by yourself, it is on the yellow line.

Well presented area of heroic figures from the past. We visited this square with several other tour groups and heard the whole history of Hungary! Too much information, but a well presented square with much historic significance

You won't get as much out of the square without a guide or a guide book. Nice park and interesting statues, but it needs more.
