So well done. This place is worth the money $6. It is so well done and beautiful. I learned a lot and enjoyed myself even though I am not big into wwii

A huge plaza.... Been there many times. Metro-line 1 hits this plaza (search for this lines history, very interesting - specially built for a royal wedding or close). You need some mentally rest, try the museum terrace and a coffee (an outside bar in summer-time) or something and just enjoy.

Historical Place. Is the square that is at one of the ends of Andrassy ut. Near the Zoo and the Vajdahunyad Castle that has an opening to the VarosLiget lake, that in the winter serves as the biggest ice skating place in open air in Europe.If you go by yourself I would recommend you to read about it before or take a city guide tour.

Must see . The suqare is impresively built and very large and spacious so you will need a good walk through it! It is good overview of Hungarian history. Equaly impressive is the Avenue which leads to it!

So much amazing history. This is an historically important place for Busapest. However unless you had done research previously or was on one of the drop off jump on tours you wouldn't know this. There should be more information available.Hősök tere (Hungarian pronunciation: [ˈhøːʃøk ˈtɛrɛ]; English: Heroes' Square) is one of the major squares in Budapest, Hungary, noted for its iconic statue complex featuring the Seven Chieftains of the Magyars and other important national leaders, as well as the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. The square lies at the outbound end of Andrássy Avenue next to City Park (Városliget). It hosts the Museum of Fine Arts and the Műcsarnok. The square has played an important part in contemporary Hungarian history and has been a host to many political events, such as the reburial of Imre Nagy in 1989.
Grand. Toured this area by coach and a great visit bieing late March was very busy with tourist i think in peak season may be not so good to see

Must See. Fantastic! You learn very quickly monuments are huge in Budapest, and this is no exception. Its great to stop and look at for a bit on your way to the baths and there's a great little market around the corner that has very reasonably priced souvenirs.
WOW. What amazing sculptures....Must see to believe. .fantastic It is a great day out with places to eat nearby
Big square. You can use one day of visiting this park area where is one of the best baths in Budapest as well as a fortress.

Impressive, yet a bit dissapointing. This is one of the landmarks the Budapest is most known for, and I guess that is why I expected so much from it. The monument itself is very impressive, but I guess I expected more. It is bit farther from the city center then the rest of the attractions, and there is nothing around the monument except houses and busy streets. There is park behind the monument with a zoo, but we didn't go there.I think if you are in Budapest, you should definitely go and see Heroes' Square, but don't expect a classic, busy town square like I did. :)

great sculpture. This was the furthest thing from city centre (about 3Km) and we caught a bus there and back it is on the same avenue as Opera house. Once there you only need 30mins but do then walk onto the Vajdahunyad Castle.

Hero's square visit . When we got there it was a sunny day there was a few local people when one could hear we where English they where happy to tell us more about the memorial which was a interesting place
Flying visit. Don't need to spend much time here. We stopped here when we were walking to the park with the castle and the spa

Nowhere You can See something like this!!!;). As I said: 'Nowhere You can See something like this!!!;)' Really...Something really spectacular...just go there for a few hours...enjoy the beautiful statues...watch the crowd taking pictures...and say hello to Archangel Gabriel !Cheers!;)
Many better squares across Europe. The square itself is nothing special BUT still worth visiting for the walk down the main avenue that runs towards the city

Grand on a grand scale. A great stop off on the bus tours with fine museums, statues and architecture to admire. Right next to the zoo. Nearby is Robinson Restaurant for excellent drinks, snacks or meals
Vacation . Great site for photos. Kids loved seeing all the statues. Close to bis route and hop on hop off buses.
awesome. beautiful and huge! the chinese love it so much and they built a copied version in shanghai:D looks exactly the same just smaller they didn't even ask for permission
Nice. This looks lovely during the day or at night time when all lit up. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

Many excellent sites. This square was constructed in the end of the 19th century to commemorate the 1000 years existence of the Hungarian state. The central monument has a column with archangel Gabriel, surrounded with the statues of kings and some politicians. Two museums flank the central monument and in the background several other exciting buildings and not far from Heroes' Sq. we find some excellent restaurants, a pool and a zoo.
nice place. impressive statues and monuments. well worth a visit. city park next to it as well. also theres a baths located here as well as Vajdahunyad Castle which is worth a look.

Don't miss. Don't miss this attraction when visiting Budapest .Photographers beware, get there early to avoid the crowds that do gather at these venues.We were lucky,unobstructed views with little or no tourists gave us the opportunity to get some great photos.It is very close to the hop on hop off bus stop which increases visitors.

A must-see of Budapest. Stop here before a visit to City Park. This impressive square tells the history of Budapest with statues of, you guessed it, heroes! In the center of the square is a tall pillar topped by Gabriel. Below are the seven original leaders of the Magyar tribes. Statues to kings, saints and other important historical figures look down from two impressive structures on either side. Pick a sunny day and you'll get some great pictures!

magnificent sculptures.. This is a superb historical site that should be visited on any holiday to the wonderful city of Budapest. We had jumped the metro down to Heroes Square on a Saturday morning and the crowd's here were quite large with several coaches and hop on hop off busses here bringing in large groups of tourists. The monument and statue's are impressive and the square itself is grand with several really nice buildings surrounding the square. We had a wander around taking photographs and admiring the stunning statues. There is also a park here with what looks like a man made lake and again some interesting architecture. Very easy to locate we chose to get here by jumping on the metro at Okogon were you go down 4 stops to stop Hostok Tere which drop's you off at the Square or you can simply walk down the very impressive long street Andrassy Utca were the square is located at the end of the street. A great tourist attraction and well worth checking out on any holiday to Budapest.
Great stop !. This place is nearby the Szechenyi Thermal Baths. Nice panoramic pictures !! Make sure to visit this lovely place!

Worth the walk. On our final day in Budapest we decided to walk to heroes square.If you like walking do it but it's a long one.It's just one street from centre with interesting shops café's etc.Heroes Square is a beautiful monument of marble and bronze.There is a cafe and tourist info nearby,and a lovely park which must be nice in summer.A bus ,tram or taxi would be the best way to get there.
Very busy and beautiful square. We arrived like so many others by bus tour, it gets crowded so go early. plenty of places to get a drink or bite to eat

Great plaza, must visit. This is one of the main attractions in Budapest. We passed by this plaza several times by walking to the thermal bath or to the nearby park. There are always many people here day or night. It is a great place to admire all the Hungarian heroes.
Historic and beautiful. If you are visiting Budapest, you must visit this place. It represents the history of the country and its an amazing view

Simply beautiful!. This square is just so big and monumental, it's unbelieveable. Museum/Gallery on each side of the square and you can tkae great pictures of the square from the middle of it.. I'm still amazed! =)

Very impressive large square. I was quite surprised by what wasn't here. There were no food trucks or souvenir vendors. Lots of people milling around taking pictures. Very impressive Millenary monument designed in, when else, 1896 to mark the 1000th anniversary of the Magyar conquest of the Carpathian Basin. 2 colonnades behind with 14 statues of rulers and statesmen. I particularly liked the statues at the very bottom of Heroes Monument of Arpad and 6 other Magyar chieftains. They were quite regal and impressive. Beautiful castle and adjacent church are just behind Heroes Square in City Park.i

Great Monument and walk up Andrassy Utca. Worth your time to walk up the "Champs Elysees of Budapest" Andrassy Utca. Enjoy the views and the shops changing to old manors as you approach the heroes' square. If you have the time, also go for a dip in the Szecsenyi baths in the park just behind the monument

Outstanding Massive Millenary Monument. Everyone visiting Budapest should go to Heroes' Square next to the City Park to see the high pillar backed by two colonnades to the right and left. It was devoted to the history of Hungary with statues of both Kings of Hungary and Princes of Transylvania
Nice. Big place, where you ll find a lot turist taking picture....Nice Architecture.must to do. over there was also a ice skating place, really nice
nice place to see. nice place to see and take some picture .we go there on our way to szechenyi spa and i think it was nice.

Cheifs of the Magyars. We entered the square via Andrassy Avenue a long wide avenue full of historical landmarks and grand houses onto the huge opening of the Square, surrounding the tower are the statues of the 7 Magyar Chiefs plus other historical dignitaries and there is the tomb of the unknown soldier then at the back of the square is the City Park, a very interesting and informative visit.

The 'grand place' of Budapest. The square with the monuments of Hungarian heroes, National gallery and Exhibition building, the Szeczeny bath and big park close to it is one of the most important attractions for all tourists
a large space. nice place to visit and is much bigger then you think from the picture and close to other attractions
Beautiful. Really lovely atmosphere and lovely place to visit. Nice park nearby and interesting history locally. Easy to find too, worth walking up Andrassy Street to look at the buildings too.

A different view of Budapest. Heroes' Square is much larger and more spacious than I expected! And it is much different from the other attractions in Budapest, so it provides a different flare to the architecture you see in Budapest.

Wander round and imagine!!!. An awe inspiring space in the City. Lots of empty space but imagine the rallies that took place here in the quietness of it all. At the change point of the tour buses and on yellow metro line so easy to find.

Heroes' Square. I went to Budapest on a whim. The best site was heroes' square. It was a very sunny day, there weren't very many people in the square, around 3:15pm when I went. It's a very peaceful place.

You can almost smell the history. Very large paved square at end of Andrassy ut . Nice sculptures and museums surround it with city park next door and zoo . It takes you back in time to the communist era
Nice but nothing special. Nice plaza with many statues of all periods of Hungarian history but not much to do so a drive around the square is probably enough.
Sculptural Dream. Beautiful rotunda filled with statues of heroes of Budapest's past. Surrounded by Vajdahunyad castle and Szechenyi baths and a museum.

Must See!. Lovely part of the city. Must go and see this. Lots of things going on. Including museums, beer bikes and sightseeing. You get a real feel like you are in the middle of this beautiful city, surrounded by people and beautiful buildings.
Nice to look at. We didn't find much to do around this area but it was a nice stop on the way to the spa which we had booked.

A long walk out of town!!. We walked to the square from our hotel on Vaci Ucta - it took us about an hour. It was a very impressive sight but not much else to see in the park in March. Probably would be a stunning location and park in the summer when everything was green and the flowers blooming !

Nice monument. Nice monument and good place for pictures. If you have more time you can spend little bit of him. Good location, not far away from center. Near to him have good park and Széchenyi Thermal Bath.
Perfect day out with the Kids. Heroes square is one of Budapest's must see things, beautiful historical site and next to ba very very nice City Park Budapest where you can spend a hole day.

Worth a visit . Stumbled upon this place whilst wondering around and I would recommend a visit, it's beautifully done and there are also lots of other things in the surrounding area to do. The only thing I would say is I would recommend doing some research before going so you know who / what you're looking at
Great for pictures. If you take the big bus tour it is its first and last stop on the tour, great monument for pictures. The zoo and park in same area. T here is also a restaurant.

Good attraction off the top 10 list.. This is on the Eastern tip of Andrassy Street - very affluent, but slightly off the centre. If you came for a bath experience in the nearby Szechenyi thermal pool - then do take a minute to enjoy, but otherwise there are a lot more things to do in Budapest.
An amazing monument. A good 40 minute walk from CBD but worth it. A huge structure in an open air plaza. lots of monuments surround it & interesting to read their history
Very thought provoking. Large historical site and is stopping point on the hop on hop off bus tour. Good place to take photographs as well.

Good place for photos . I suggest you download some info or take a good guide book with you so that you know what you are looking at and who these people were and what they did for Budapest. If you have wifi or data while abroad you can always Google. Weekends can be busy and there are groups of local teens hanging around so it is worthwhile keeping an eye on your bags, phones and cameras.

An epic place. I spent there approximately 30 minutes just watching on every little detail on those statues. I can say with no doubt that the sculptor put all his/her soul in them. They are true masterpieces. I advise everybody to visit it especially at night time.

Impressive Home of Heros of Hungary. Nice open space not a square as such but a semicircular Greco Roman home for statues of great warriors and rulers surrounding a central column and statute. Placed for maximum impact.

Worth a stare. If you're up this way for the thermals or the zoo it's worth taking a look at this pretty sizeable square with some excellent sculptings. You probably won't spend more than 10 mins here if you're not sure who the people depicted are but its worth a gawp

Huge square - massive. The scale of the square is amazing. Seemingly Michael Jackson recorded a video here. Just behind the square is a tourist information office. We caught the tube to the square which was very straighforward.

Not much to it, except for the view. It's a nice monument, I doubt many people know about it as it's a little bit outside of centre of Budapest. It's worth the trek to see it, you also get to enjoy the scenery around it as well.
Splendid. Great architecture. Lots of history about Hungary. Plenty to see. Flat so easy to walk about. Gods for disabled/wheel chair users.
Nice square. Breathtaking site with nice landscape and statues. It's the Hungarian Champs Elysées. Perfect to start the visit of Budapest.

Must see. Heroes square is one of the most beautiful sights in Budapest. It is not just an amazing sight, but also you can find a lot of things here: three museum (for example Museum of Fine Arts), city park, thermal bath, castle, zoo and classy restaurants. I would highly recommend to spend a day here: sights, museum, a great lunch in the Robinson and a relaxing bath.
More to it than you think. Ice skating held here in winter and there are so many lovely ornate buildings nearby. Easy to reach using metro. Nice park behind the square

Heros of Hungary. Beautiful and not touristy/ commercialized when I visit in February morning.
Have a guide to help you identify the statues and story's of the chieftain/ and important national leaders of Hungary.
great statues. A historical place, have been creatively produced. Close to szechenya baths - we visits these things together as they are away from the centre.
Amazing. We visited by chance after the baths. A wonderful photo spot! Can spend a good while admiring the statues!

An afternoon in the sun. This attraction tells you a great deal about famous people in Hungary's history. It also is the location of the tomb of the Hungarian unknown soldier. A large square of statues and beautiful stone architecture. The afternoon we were there they were setting up for a ceremony of some sort. Well worth seeing
Still amazed. Simply amazing. I walk past heroes square everyday and still caan't get enough it. Beautiful, peaceful and so much history behind it. A must see!!
Photospot. Nice place to take couple of shots when walking around the town. Best time to go when there is not a lot people milling around.
Beautiful! . One of the beautiful and historic sights of Budapest another one of the must sees! There's an ice rink close by in winter and think at the moment they are prepping for Davis cup tennis

Nice historic photo spot. The Hero's Square can be easily reached by metro line 4, and lies within a huge park few minutes walk from Budapest Zoo. You can have a good fill of photography and history here, and learn that main metro stations in Budapest are named after the heroes fetured on the statues around the square...
Nice for photos. Nice place to visit and take photos. The monument represents the seven tribes whom the hungrian people compiled of.

Heroes Square in Budapest, Hungary - A world heritage site!. I have always been passionate about European squares - romantic; vibrant; full of life! And when such a square is a world heritage site then it becomes more interesting. Let us explore the symbolism of one such square, Heroes' square in Budapest, Hungary. Head over to my blog - Realizations and find Hungary from chirasri dot blogspot dot com
Nice one.. Looked like Paris. Nice monument to see, tho little far away and out or route if you miss this you shouldnt feel sorry as well.

Great stroll. We spent an entertaining fifteen minutes at night strolling around the columns and looking at the statues. It's a clean and sleek square that we stumbled on by accident coming from the gardens with the Szechenyi baths in. We went at night, which was extra pretty, and there was a group of locals training puppies, which was extra quirky.

Okay to see. Went here as was on the way to the zoo. As with something like the brandaburg gate its something to see and look at with not alot to do. Good to pass by and photo op for 10 mins if passing. I wouldnt make a special trip here though..

Magnificent . Walked past thus at night in the rain after the Szechenyi baths. What an imposing sight even in the rain at night. Helps one imagine the 12 Magyar tribes agreeing to settle and form a new nation. Gives you a very good idea if how it all began.

Impresive. Along with my friend, we went to this square through the use of train and we have stopped just few metres away. Once we arrived there we were impressed by the size of this square and most of all by the monument which is there. moreover, from here we also took the opportunity to go around the park which is found behind it and we were astonished by how many people make use of this park all for different aspects.

Must visit here on way to city park for ice skating, circus or baths, or fine art museum. We stopped her for a photo moment on the way to baths in City Park, the largest in Budapest. A huge square with statues of heroes through the ages.
Nice. Nice square next to which during the winter there's an ice rink with lots of people ice skating. Worth to pass by if you're around
World Heritage Site.. One of the top attractions of Budapest. Often visited by state dignitaries to pay tribute to the Nations' Heroes.

A sight for a quick glance.. Heroes square is a nice place to see quickly, it doesn't take much time as there isn't much to see but it doesn't mean it's not nice. It is an impressive big monument to see.

Interesting place to visit. At the entrance to the local park and attractions and close to the famous Thermal Baths and outdoor Ice Rink. an attraction with statues to show the many historical events in Budapest
Heroes square . Main point of Budapest from where the tour starts. Closer to kaleti station. Each and every statue of all the king's talks about their history and how they ruled Hungary

Nice to see. Heroes square is near the zoo,spa and ice rink. If you are in the area it is worth going to have a look.
The area is very open with the statues at one end.
Watch out for beggars and people trying to sell you stuff here
Symbolic. Historical Statues Through Hungarian History. Use to be Poignant for Communist Displays. A Worthwhile Visit and Free. Practically Unspoilt.

More History. At the end of Andrassy Street one of the main streets in Peste's side you will find it. It is more interesting if you can go with a guide tour that will explain to you who were the people carved out.
Interesting. Use the hop on bus to get there.its very clean,the statues are worth visiting.there's a restaurant and tourist information centre There.visit when is a sunny day.

always something happening here. since living near to Heroes square I can visit it anytime, it is nice to cross the park behind the square, find a statue I never seen before in Vajdahunyad castle and get to this wide square with the many statues and the two museums dominating it (Fine Arts is closed now for renpvations untill 2018). The square is always different, either tourists visiting it, or concerts and other events held here
Nice monument. A nice enough monument, but probably not worth a trip in its own right. Handily, it's very close to other sights.

Impressive riders on horses.. The square is beautiful, It has an array of important Hungarian kings and leaders on horses,some are really impressive. The square is quite large and there is a ice-skate park near it, at least during the winter months.Easily accessible by public transport.

Love the place!. This is one of my favorites places in Budapest. In the winter you can visit the square and end up at the restaurant nect to it that overlooks the HUGE skating rink while drinking mulled wife. If you don't feel like skating or waiting at the restaurant you can go to the Szecheny baths that arr also in the area. So each person in the family gets to do what pleases them the most.The hero square is also sorrounded by a few museums and is next to a gorgeous castle with a nice garden with a lake, which ends up being a nice area to go to in the summer
Fabulous space . Heroes square is a fabulous space.Worth a visit. As are the 2 museums on the square. Close to the metro. On the hop on bus routes. Close to the park entrance.

Beautiful Monument!. Heroes's Square was easily accessible by tram and close to walking trails and a beautiful church. This whole area was full of interesting monuments and local shops. Not very crowded and free to see.

The Soul of the Hungarians.. Heroes' Square is the essence of the Hungarians. The Kings of the Hungarian Tribes who settled in Hungary are represented here. This monument represents the migration of the Hungarian Tribes who settled in Hungary over a 1000 years ago. It is cool and absolutely a must see. For young children you can stimulate their imagination with the wonderful statues of the various Kings in their tradition clothing, with weapons and War Horses. I take every single visitor who comes to Hungary to see Heroes' Square it equates with the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin or the Tower of London. So do it.

Large square with nice statues. This is a very large open square with not much to see except for the monument and statues. Take some time and check out the statues of the Seven Chieftains of the Magyars.
in MEMORY OF THE ONES THAT DIED>. this is the CENOTAPHE of BUDAPEST .a place of REMEMBRANCE for the people that died.a place of peace & tranquillity

Impressive square. We walked to the square along Andrassy avenue (probably about 2km). The land on the Pest side of the Danube is flat so it is suitable for anyone.The square is quite large and filled with tourists at weekends, but is well worth the effort to see it. There are many statues of Hungarian heroes from antiquity and those of the long gone Hapsburg emperors.The square is on the main bus routes.
Check if you're around. Nice square full of statues of the grumpy old men. Nothing special, but the buildings around are pretty.

Pretty square, crawling with tourists (including us!). Wide open space in front of the monuments allows for great picture taking opportunities. Even in February, lots of tourists climbing the steps to take a pic at the base of the tallest memorial in the park.

absolutely amazing visit. we finally got here on saturday by taking the hop on and off bus, thats another adventure in itself, Heroes sq is busy with tourists but youll still manage to get some amazing pics.once we did this we wandered off back down the Andrassy road on foot . well worth taking the time to see this place
Good . Interesting but no signs on the monuments in english , must have a guide with you to explain, otherwise great place to walk around

Looks great at night. The square was really nice to see at night, when it's all lit-up. It's really easy to get to via the Metro. While here we also visited the nearby park. The square won't take up much of your time, but it's worth seeing if you're nearby.

Incredibly Impressive. Heroes' Square is almost at the end of the subway line, but if you're going to the Szechenyi Baths (which you should), you can easily go to the incredibly impressive Heroes' Square, too.The Square used to be a big meeting a rally point for communist rallies, and it's easy to see why. The Square is enormous. There are huge monuments, pillars and columns in the Square, too, and it's crazy to think about how many people can fit in it when there's something going on. It's not too crowded on the average day in Budapest now, so it's easy to get some space and be able to see what you want to see without pushing people out of the way.The Square isn't somewhere you are going to spend a lot of time, but there's a subway station right by the Square, so you can easily see it without having to walk a long way.

Big wide open nothing.. I think these types of honor are important BUT this one really was small given the space. The statues were very daring and you could imagine the strength of the Hungarian army but overall, lack luster visit.
Impressive place. Amazing feeling, especially when you visited him at night. The impressive and very crowded. In the vicinity monumental buildings. A wonderful place for photographers.
Very nice!. Beautiful place, a great place for an evening walk. The view is really impressive so don't forget to takae a camera!

A long walk with a great payoff. It is about a two mile walk down Andrassy Street, which is meant to look like the Champs Elysee, to get to the Heroes Square. The square is where you would see the Arch d'Triumph in Paris. The square has about 20 statues and all of them are magnificent. You can get some great panoramic photos. Behind the square is a massive park. Between the park and the square you can easily spend 4-5 hours.

Focal Point. I think there are a number of areas of interest in the city that could be described as a focal point, and as with the others, there is perhaps a lack of information about the monument to the average tourist, but if you do a little research you cant fail to be impressed by Heroes' Square.
Historic and Beautiful . A definite site to visit. This place is a great view for pictures. There's also another museum right at the corner. Definite must to visit in the city.

Late night stroll. An impressive monument to the founders of Hungary. Loved the grand statues. All very heroic. It was splendidly lit up at night. The Ice skating rink, Zoo and baths are nearby as too are several great restaurants.
Large square very interesting. We walked here and took photos although we where not sure who the people where, but none the least it was very interesting.
Morning Stroll. Its lovely up around here for a walk in the morning. There is a lovely park over behind the ice ring and is nice to stroll around and take in the city.

This is the largest square in Budapest.. It was created to celebrated Hungary's 1000th birthday and it stands at the end of Andrassy Ave and by City Park. On top of the column is Archangel Gabriel and the seven Hungarian chieftains who led the Magyar to Hungary are below. It is impressive both by day and by night. To the left of the square is the Museum of Fine Arts and the Hall of Art is on the right.
Beautiful one 😍. The area by itself is really nice: Andrassy street, heroe's square, the ice rink, the park... Worth for a long walk and lots of pictures to be taken❗️
So beautiful! . This is a must. Very intricate statues. Would highly recommend! Large square with different heroes. Looks beautiful at night.
Away from the main highlights. Most attractions are on either side of the Danube. However, this is a short bus / tram ride away. If you have time a nice long walk would be good and worth it.
Amazing square. One of the most beautiful square of the city. It leaves you with out words, simply quite and characteristic! It's nearby the Szechenyi spa! Absolitely to visit! :)
A square. We drove around this square on a bus so didn't get to see much of it up close, it is in memorial to Hungarian Heroes.
Great. A fantastic area to visit. Everything is so big and grand and looks amazing. The park behind is well worth a walk round too.

Interesting spot. I enjoyed visiting this location. It is an convenient spot to switch tour buses, takes pictures, and also have a bit to eat right next door. Along the river behind the square, there is spot for paddle boating and a lovely bridge with great views. The square is large and the statues are beautiful. It is not an attraction to plan spending lots of time enjoying, but it is worth a quick visit.

Celebrates Hungarian History. Forgive me if I get it wrong but I believe this site celebrates the 1000+ years of the Maygar (Hungarian) People ? I learnt this from my stamp collection and History in High School ? Either way this is an Impressive Square at the end of Andrassy Avenue's long travel from the top end (Danube) and is a collection of Statues of the more revered persons of past history and flanked by two Museums and has the Park, Zoo & other attractions onwards ! Well worth a look around.

Very good place from whom you could reach everything in Budapest. There is Millennium Monument which dominated of it. It's got this name because of the celebration of the millennial anniversary of the Hungarian immigration. As part of the monument there are statues of the seven tribal leaders and many other historical figures. As part of the Heroes' Square, there are two important museums - the Museum of Fine Arts and the Museum of Contemporary Art and nearby the Budapest Zoo .

Well worth a look. Had a look around the impressive square in the snow. It's a big square, lots of statues and plenty to photograph. I haven't seen it at night but I believe it is even more impressive lit up.
Very beautiful, but not much to do. Beautiful site, but not much to do but relax and wander around the park. Great for a low-key day, but make sure you see the rest of the park.
Very very wet. Came here in the pouring rain one evening. Lovely pictures but very wet. Best bit was 8 boys cycling with beer past the monument.
Impressive. This square is very large and impressive and reflects the pride of the Hungarian people and their history.

Great for photographs. A really lovely place with great statues and monuments. Large open space and great for photographs. Easy to find although there did not appear to be many places to grab a drink or bite to eat nearby.

Great viewing . This was well over a 3 mile round trip to get to Heroes Square, never the less the statues are great to look at and a wonderful piece of history
Definitely worth the walk

Hero's square. Worth a visit but you do have to cross very busy road. The bus tour takes you here and it's on the way to the zoo as well as one of the baths. If you are short on time or are not going on way to elsewhere then you could omit this.

Interesting if you like looking at buildings. OK if you like looking landmarks and would only need 15 mins if you didn't want to go into the museums. Went at xmas and expected to visit xmas markets but none present.
Vast open square. Big square at the center of Budapest, mighty statues and columns stand still waiting for huge gathering of people. Could be crowded of tourist sometimes.
Honor of Heros. This is a beautiful square with the unknown tomb of the fallen heros. Just past this is a GREAT small castel, huge ice skating ring and park.
worth a visit. Well worth a visit in a very nice area next to a lovely park and zoo, it's very nice during the day but even nicer at night beautiful lovely view from there too

Impressive. Impressive heroes square can be easily accessed by metro links close by. The square itself is a busy roundabout. Nice to see and behind the square is the city park. Not a lot of info on the square itself to read or marvel at however the structure is great to look at.

Like Trafalgar Square with history.. Heroes' Square is at the end of Andrassy Avenue and is the terminus of the Big Bus Hop On Hop Off Tour Its like The Cenotaph, Trafalgar Square and a war memorial all in one. Very important to the local population and the site for many ceremonies. Should be visited on any tour of Pest.

This is more than 5 points!. Our favorite in the city! I gave 2 wow-s for another attraction , this place needs 3 or 4!! Heroes square....no words....a must....can be connected with the city parkand the catle Vajdahunad. Also close to the thermal bath Szechenyi... 1 complete day of our 8 days in Budapesht. Wow.....
A lovely park with heroes' statues and tomb of the unknown soldier. A look at the history of Hungary as you gaze at the beautiful statues. In downtown area, the square is stunning to view.

Rear place to visit. Could happily spend all day here. When we visited here it was a bright,sunny winters day and it was perfect.Watching people ice-skating with the sun shining was a lovely contrast.This park goes on for miles and is full of interesting monuments to see.
Huge park!. Statues in this park are the main attraction for sure! everything is huge and beautiful, and if you're visiting it when it's winter, the ice-skating close to it is a must see place!
pretty. very pretty statue, with two museums on either side, followed by a few more attractions surrounding!

Signature spot in Budapest. Monumental square, a must see for everyone who's in Budapest and not only because of the tourist books' mandatory visit! It truly implies the great history of the Hungarian people.
Hungary's national heroes gather together. The most spacious square in Budapest and the most sacred place for Hungary. Interesting events frequently take place here
Very interesting. Once again this was part of the city tour, very interesting, you can easily get here by metro, it's close to the ice skating ring and zoo
Powerful Monument!. Impressive monument with lovely park, ice skate, zoo and thermal bath at nearby area. Very easy accessible by public transport.
Impressive. Stopped here whilst doing the bus tour. Stunning monuments. Didn't stay to long but it's in a lovely part of the city. There's the ice rink, zoo and baths nearby as well.
Amazing. The reason I fell in love with budapest. Visiting this at night is a must. Words can't describe how beautiful this monument really is.
Great at night. Simple yet stunning, especially at night. It's at the end of Andrassy and near the ice skating rink and vajdahunyad var.

Worth a visit as there are good restaurants near by. What strikes us about Hero's Square are the size of the statues and its worth a visit just to see these. We could walk up from the hotel which took you through a residential district of very grand and old houses, so the walk was worth it just to see the architecture of these buildings.you dont need more than half and hour here, but then you have two good restaurants near by and the Vajdahunyad Castle is just across the road
Stunning. Would recommend seeing this at night, all lit up. Its very impressive and beautiful. At the very top of Andrassy, very easy to find.

So impressive... You walk up Andrassy and then hit this at the end. It really is wonderful. Plus you have the baths, art gallery, circus and zoo close by? Get the tube back in to the centre, such cute little trains!
Powerful. A nice end to the Ardrassy Avenue stroll. Not a "must see" bit interesting to see the way Hungarians remember its heroes and history. Near to parks and galleries. Subway stop right there.
Nice . Big . Any nothing more.. Nice. Big. And nothing more.The best thing about it is the nice park among it and the miniral pool near the park

Huge open space - Impressive. We walked through Heroes' Square on the way to the Szechenyi Baths and Pool. Its a very impressive Square...
I am not sure if its a walk just for that but would definitely say it is worth either walking up or getting off the bus early to walk past if you're travelling that way for something else.

lovely monument. went there at night, lovely monument and square, however there was only one bus to get there, maybe it was Christmas period. Did not notice any restaurants around or they were closed when we went.

Amazing!. Huge square with the monument about the tribes that started Hungary. One of the most beautiful squares in Budapest. The whole place is very charming, just ignore the people trying to sell you things.
Very pretty. No information. Amazing views. No info on what it is but looks impressive. Only there for 5 mins not a all day thing. Lots of traffic around it

Nice Monument. It's a definite must see in Budapest. They monument is impressive along with the accompanying views from the square. Yes there are more impressive Heroes' Squares in Europe, but this one is worth the visit for it's own unique qualities.
Nice view, not much else. . Lovely view, especially at night with the monument lit up. Not much more than a nice view really though. Worth seeing if you're in the area for the zoo or spa though.

Amazing. What a fantastic place to visit, somehow made even more impressive by the fact it was snowing. A place for some pretty spectacular photographs. The monuments and the square itself are huge.
Just across the street locals were enjoying the weekend ice skating on the frozen river.

Nice square near the zoo and spa.. Next to the park, where the zoo, circus and spa can be found, lays this famous square.
When you visit, one of the above named places, just walk to this area, to see the nice sculptures.

Take a good guide book or preferably a local guide. Such a lot of history to be learnt here. Being January and very cold there were few tourists around which suited us well. So much to see in the surrounding area also.
Big Square. It's within walking distance from Szechenyi Baths and Pool. They have the huge Budapest sign in the square. Mucsarnok Palace of Art is across the street from the square.
A Must see. Very nice square beautiful sculptures and lots pride and history, beautiful surrounds, nice to spend a couple hours in the zone
Beautiful . Perfect for a romantic walk and for some amazing pictures. Located just next to the "város liget-park" where u can spend some quality time too 👌
Beautiful. Beautiful monument, a large open space for taking photographs and strolling around. Very impressive.

Must visit it . Fortunately we visited the square with a local guide who explained us everything about every single statue.
It was a lesson of Hungarian History.
It was very cold though.

Amazing..A must see. Heroes square is formidable with archangel Gabriel overlooking everyone..the architecture and sculptures..bronze statues defy belief..the horses are so lifelike and engender a sense of awe..trepidation even..for any second they could gallop to life..the sense of space is wonderful..I went in January and there were very few tourists..It is a lovely time of year to visit..

A must visit!. We went to heroes square as a lot of things to see and do seemed to be around here,We were not disappointed, the square itself is very impressive & there is an ice skating rink right next to it which is a must! This is also right next to the zoo & botanical gardens and many good top rated restaurants that are affordable!Worth a visit
Wonderful. Very crowded at times, and parking difficult due to this. Of great historical significance. A must see.

beautiful. this place is beautiful and grandeur, yet its hard to understand all its importance if you go there without a proper guide who informs you about all the different persons depicted on the monuments. but it's a must-see

Beautiful, historic and gives entry to the Museum of Fine Arts!. This is a focus point of Budapest city center, since it is the end\start of Andrassy street, that leads also to Deak Ferenc Square. The several statues of the heroes of Hungary take place in a huge open space and it is beside two art museums. One of them is the Museum of Fine Art. Must see!Most of all, this is square is the entrance to the city park which you can relax after walking inside the museums.'10
Beautiful. Wonderful amazing place to visit. Stunning architecture. Must see. Try the bus tour that goes via here. Also easy to walk to.

Very scenic . Lots to look at and plenty of things to do, ice skating in a huge rink was close by, nice places to eat and even if it's a bit of a walk
Away the area is lovely

A milenary history. One of Budapest's most impressive landmarks. The central column and the statues of the Hungarian kings are amazing! Try to avoid the gypsy women that try to sell low quality products!

Expansive Square, Beautiful Memorial and Illuminating at Night. It was a stunning and beautiful memorial, especially at night due to the illuminating lights. The square was expansive and the central pillar was tall and grand. The memorial square was a great spot for a short visit.
Beautiful Budapest. The statues, architecture, and historical sights are not to be missed. It's very calming to stroll around and think about the proud history of the Maygars.
Heroe's square.. this is really quite humbling to visit but certainly worth doing . It looks amazing at night all lit up too.
Very nice . Very good too see , have statues of famous Hungary wariors and its huge. Very attractive for tourist people to take pictures .

Stunning Monument. Heroes Square is a beautiful, stunning monument at the top of town, easy to get to by metro. You can take beautiful photographs by day but even better by night. Great place to spend 20 to 30 minutes.
Wonderful Place. The statues and square is absolutely beautiful, it's large and open and each statue is completely different. It's a definite visit must for Budapest

Interesting, but what else?. Commenting on something like this one run the risk of offending the local people. Unfortunately I was not really impressed with this square. Sure, it is big and sure it has the statues atop the facade on one side. Yes, the sculptures are very well executed. What I found more interesting are the small, intimate cathedral just across the river (which, by the way, is converted into a large open air skating rink in winter) and the main arterial which runs to the square, as are the buildings surrounding the square. Apart from all the different buildings on this route, the very visible holes in the walls, a sign of wartime fighting, I found more interesting. So for me the square was more the end destination rather than the focal point.

No Plaques . We went there to have a look, hoping there may have been some kind of information plaque or something similar. While the monument itself was impressive, the lack of readily available information about the area was disappointing. We had to Wikipedia it when we got back.
Cool. It was cool. Big monuments in a big empty area. I dont really have much more to say about it than that.

The statues remind me of The Lord of The Rings. This square is a bit further from the city centre but is very nice and spacious with lots of statues of kings which I really liked. It looks very nice in the evening. I recommend to take the cute small metro line to get there or walk the street which is considered the Champs-Elysees of Budapest.

true heart of the city .... Great starting point for visiting Budapest ...
Many attractions near or in walk distance ...
Don't miss zoo and ice skating in winter time ...

Awesome!. Another got to see of Budapest.
The statues are so impressive and so large. Surrounded by grand buildings and lovely vistas this is indeed a fitting, special place to remember the Heroes of Hungary through history.
Quite magnificent!
Nice square . Nice big square on the end of what you could describe as a champignons d else. It remembers the Hungarian heroes of the past, but is mostly impressive because of the large open space.

Swing by when you are near the Spa!. This was nice to see when we went to the spa and ice skating. It was a long walk up from the centre,m. I probably wouldn't have done it just to see the square, but you are almost definitely going to be near by if you visit the baths/Ice rink/zoo and would be a shame to miss

Absolutely stunning ............ I was taken aback by the stunning architecture and grand scale of the monuments. Open area in front of these warrior statues. Simply fab. Not to be missed.
20 min. underground train journey from the chain bridge.

Nice!. Nice place to visit w/ very beautiful statues, but not in the cold weather 😌 The ice skating field right behind it is also nice. The entrance fee is between 1000-2000 HBF for adults depending on the day and time.

Great photo opportunity . I stumbled upon the square on my way back from the zoo (which I loved). Head out of town to the square and walk through the park, visit the museums or galleries off the square. While you are on the square admire the statues in their grandeur. Watch the world go by around you. It's free! The walk from the Jewish quarter is 10-15mins max. It's down a long straight road so you can't really miss it

Really nice place. I didn't stay for long because of the cold day and the wind. It's a big area with the National museum, the square and a cultural center. On the Square there were lots of statues to see.Walk the Addrassy street to reach the place. A really beautiful street.

As Long as You Understand What You Are Looking At. This Square is worth the visit. Great Historical Monument. Easily accessible by public transport. Adjacent to several other sites, zoo, baths and others. Don't miss it. Very nice.

Loved the Bronzes. The square is large but there were a lot of tourists the day that I was there. It's really hard to fit all the square into a photo unless you have a very wide angle lens. I loved all the bronze statues and the plaques underneath some of them. Gives you more understanding of the Hungarian people

A Truly Beautiful Memorial. I was very taken by this monument, and was fortunate enough to see it after lunch on the way to the zoo. I am so fascinated with it that I am planning to Google all the details on it. Very nice.
Nice view. It is a must see in Budapest. There are no many. It is worth to visit also by night and in the afternoon as well.
Impressive. You probably don't need to spend very long here, but its a very impressive sight- the sheer space is enough to make you feel small and the statues are huge.
My wife and I . My wife and I have been in the morning and evening and I have been in the next day and night of the Circle of the hero
Worth a wander. Visited as part of a cycling tour, and it is impressive to see this plaza and the various types of architecture surrounding it.
Impressive. I really liked this place. It is huge and impressive. It is a bit far from city centre but don't forget to go there.

Bigger than I was Expecting. The square and memorial is much larger than I was expecting but well worth the visit nonetheless. I am glad I visited the Parliament before coming here as there are no English descriptions of who the statues are or their significance to Budapest. However, I did learn about the major ones on my tour in the Parliament.
Thought provoking. Very big square with lots of fascinating statues and stories - you need a guide to get the best out of the visit.

The best square in Budapest!. We came there by Metro, exit is right next to square.
It was amazing!! We saw it in sunset and by night. Such amazing pictures! There is so much history there and amazing architecture.

Huge Plaza. If you are going to visit this huge plaza, I highly recommend that you have a tour guide with you. The tour guide will be able to explain to you how the plaza was created; who are the statues around the plaza; and their role in Hungary's history. Otherwise, it will be just a plaza you will be seeing and it will not be worth your time.

Hugely impressive . Unfathomably large statues, presumably copper, surround a huge singular column. Well worth a visit in its own right, but even more so considering its proximity to two museums, the park, the baths & the castle.Amazing, and a great photo opportunity.

Back in time. This majestic place is located little bit further from budapest city centre but also with subway doesn't take more than few minutes to get there . Near this square is budapest zoo , cirkus and thermal bath .
Very grand. Well worth a visit. Right by the metro and the City Park is behind which is also worth a visit as very pleasant.

An overrated square. i made an effort to visit this place all the way..but i am sorry to say that it wasnt worth the effort..if you have travelled enough around europe and seen beautiful architecture; you can easily choose to skip this

Underated and no information . The monument itself is a large area with semi circle centred statues and edifices. At night a well lit spot. Again, there are no historical signs or information here. Not even in a corner area showing what it is or represents. The tomb of the unknown soldier is located here, where you can walk in, no security or soldiers standing guard....nothing. Rather odd. Worthy of a visit but I had to wikipedia the site for any information at all.

u feel the brave of this place. u feel the brave of this place when u reach and see these structure. we enjoyed listening to an audio in hop on hop off buses about this square. also the weather was a lityle bit warm that day so we enjoy every thing.

Historical stories still remain. I walked here on a breezy summer morning. The square amazed me with its grand space and spectacular sculptures. Somehow the air that day gave a me a chill when I think of the history stories behind this landmark...
Great. This is true amazing place to visit. All squares in Budapest are great, but this one is amazing. Truly historical place which you have to visit once you're in Budapest.

Enormous monument in impressive surroundings. Situated at the northern end of Andrassy Avenue, Heroes Square is an impressively huge pedestrianised square with a central memorial to Magyar founders of the Hungarian nation. We visited at 8am and it was completely deserted. Really easy to get to from the metro (just across the road which encircles the square) and well worth an early morning visit to soak up the atmosphere. On the edges of the square are impressive neo classical buildings which house the museum of Fine Arts and behind the square is a huge park and lakes which are well worth whiling away the hours in.

Very impressive . Stumbled across this whilst heading to the ice skating rink opposite - massive square with beautiful statues both in the middle and around the outside. Later found out more about the history - very powerful and symbolic to Hungary.

One of the "must" -places in Budapest. It's a great looking square. Good for photographing. The visit here is easily combined to a visit in the amusement park, or the zoo or the Szechnya spa. You get here easily with metro and there are other fine sighs nearby (an old castle e.g.)
big square. big square with nice building around it... this was the place where the marathon started last year...

Worth a visit . This is a good place to visit as it's so close to the skating ring and the baths. It's a good day out as there are a number of things to do right next to it. Also in the park is a restaurant over looking the lake which is really good and the food and service is unavailable.

most beautiful monument in Budapest. this place fascinated me kind of harmony such respect for its past. such that we still have not seen anywhere. even the Michael Jakson the filming spot something incredible

Really cool plaza. Very interesting and larger than expected. Heroes' Square was certainly a highlight of my trip to Budapest. Although, I loved the entire city and would highly recommend visiting this wonderful city at any opportunity. Heroes' Square was a celebration of some of the most notable 'heroes" in Hungarian history. The large central spire is impressive in size and stature as are all the statues surrounding the Square. The location is very picturesque and tourist friendly. The square is very large and was not very crowded during my week-long stay. We visited or traveled by the square nearly every day as it was centrally located between various parks, attractions, baths, and museums. We did not experience any unwanted peddlers whom I expected to be there preying on tourists. Instead visitors are given free reign to enjoy the art and architecture in their own time.If you are in Budapest, make it a point to visit this area!

Giant gorgeous space and memorial. A gorgeous square in Budapest – complete with a large central monument and statues to the seven tribes who founded Hungary. It is breathtaking at night, probably equally beautiful during the day. It is near the zoo,ice skating rink, the main shopping stretch, a castle and some buildings from the Worlds Fair. It is close to many things, make sure to stop here and see it when in Budapest!

Christmas market visit to Budapest. What a fabulous city and Heroes Square is magnificent with all its statues. They are truelly amazing and huge. Just to the back of the square is an ice-rink which was amazing either for the energetic to have a go or just to sit and watch the world go by and marvel at all the school children that were so comfortable on the ice. (Games lessons were never like at my school )

Must see in Budapest. This is a bit out of the Town Center area and best accessible by the 100+ year old Metro Line 1 - which itself is a must see/ride as it is the second oldest metro in the world. Heroe's Square is near the Szechenyi Baths and replica of a Transylvanian Castle, so you can easily spend a few hours in the area.
Spacious like Vatican square. Important and largest square to vist ......I love to take as many snaps as i can ....best view to take a snap is from andrassy utca....
worth to visit - there is a icering just next to it. Very nice place - I fault in love with Budapest after seeing this square. It's so reminded me Paris (but I actually prefer Budapest).

feeling small. Quite suggestive during the night with all the artificial lights. The square is big and you fell really small. I wish there were signpost with historical informations there..
it's easy to get there cause of the metro just across the road.
Outstanding. This is a beautiful square, I would strongly recommend visiting. But go at night when it is lit up perfectly.
Beautiful place. great place to take pictures that will remind you Hungary! and look for the mobile bars around - fun thing to do!

Visit Twice. If you can I'd say visit twice, once during the day and again at night. During the day it's full of annoying folk climbing the statue in the middle and posing for photographs giving the victory sign, at night it's full of annoying folk climbing the statue in the middle and posing for photographs giving the victory sign. Stay on the ground folks, it's better for everyone.
Interesting square. Quite a big square, with statues on one side and the unknown solider tomb. Not that impressive, but if you're in the area, it's worth a visit
budapest. Place which You must see during visit in Budapest. not so far from this place - Budapest zoo which is the best choice for families with childrens.
Hello Budapest 👍. Peaceful and charming, we were lucky not so many buses at the time we arrived at the place. Good place to visit
Hungarian Heroes'. The square is large and open. There are statues of the many of the fearsome kings of the past. There is a church building nearby that looks like our supreme court, but more ornate.
Must see Heroes Square. Site is one of the best places to visit - if visiting in the summer go early in the morning to beat the heat and the hawkers.
Focal point. At the and of the Andrassy avenue you can find this awe-inspiring colonnade surrounded by museums and a park.

Nice Area. It was a little out of the way for us so was a surprisingly long walk, but I'd say it was worth it. Heroes' Square itself is nice but nothing spectacular. Combine it with the City Park behind it to make it a bit more worth it.

Like something from a film!. Jump on the metro to get there, don't drive or get a bus or walk... Why? As soon as you walk out of the M1 station at Hősök were your jaw will drop at the sheer site.Featuring the kings and emperors of the Hungarian Empire, this is a great place to take photographs in any weather; stunning on a sunny day and impressively lit at night - you're guaranteed to get some good historic snaps to take home.The Wikipedia entry gives some great information for this free attraction.

Near the ice rink. We brought our grandchildren here for ice skating a few COLD days after Christmas. The square is large and empty with the exception of the statues. The ice rink is the largest outdoor rink I've ever seen. There is an admission fir everyone which includes lockers. Skate rental is extra. Snack shops inside.

Best square so far!. Budapest has a wide variety of exceptionally beautiful attractions, and this one is certainly not out of this list. Visiting this square on a sunny day is one of the best things you can do in Budapest, with a vast covered surface, a huge monument on the center and the wonderful gates with the statues of 14 of the most important characters of the Hungarian history, it creates a really valuable experience. I recommend visiting this attraction on a guide tour since there is so much to learn about every element of it.

Beautiful. To learn more about this square I recommend going on one of the city bus tours as they tell you all about the different statues. The area is basically the centre roundabout of some busy roads, but this does not distract from the beauty of the square. The area is so big so I cannot imagine it ever being too busy with tourists for a good photo.
Cool statues. Well worth a quick visit!. This place is a must visit. Watch the statues, take some photos and then move on. It goes quick but really is an impressive sight.

Beautiful square. Beautiful place near city park , definitely worth visiting in Budapest . Good architecture and significant history . It is a free attraction . Also had a ice ring next to city park , good clean fun .
Beautiful . One thing I have learnt about Budapest is they love a statue and they do them so well. Hero's square is so clean and we'll kept and massive! I really enjoyed this
Top 3 thing to see. It is one of the main locations to visit in Budapest and many tourists go there. It is reacable by public transport

Imposing square. The architecture around the city is breathtaking and heroes square is no different. As you enter the avenue leading up to the square it dominates the horizon - easy seen on a hop on off bus.

Spectacular Monuments. We went here as it was on our way elsewhere and it was beginning to snow, it was great to see the statues but just as great to get to our final destination. Still worth a quick visit.

A must. A must attend as a place where history has put is mark.
Second time for me.
For a nice ambient place to have a coffe 200 meter from this place.
A MUST!!!. Enormous square adjacent to other attractions. Nicely lit in the night but also very nice in the day time. Numerous opportunities to make good photos, amazing square to view and walk on
Impressive. This is a lovely space, very open, with some impressive statues, a post card location that will let you take some great pictures!

Check it from all sides. . It was a bit difficult to cross the Street and reach the square because of the traffic, but we made it. See the square from all sides, each side looks unique and feels like you see different places.

Gigantic ally impressive. The sheer size of this square was awesome, the bronze statues are reduced in size because of the size of it. We did the hop on hop off bus tour of Budapest, and the guide gave us the story of all of it as we came up to it. Truly worth seeing.

Nice if you have a guide. This was our first stop in Budapest! The Heros square is a nice place if you have a tour guide who can tell you the significance which we did. Being that the area is visited by tourist year round it seems like the squares on the ground are moving causing you to trip so be careful! These are is really good place to see and take great photos. I enjoyed it, I only rated it so low because of you don't do your research prior to arriving and you visit it. It can seem pretty boring. But a great sigh to see.
Post card location. One must go to Heroe's Square when in Budapest. It's one of the post card attractions of the city. Filled with tourists. Right at the entrance of the park
Stunning. Beautiful when illuminated. Very nice during the day and plenty photo opportunities. Great open space for holiday snaps

Nice place near many monuments. Near the metro station, you can see many historical buildings as well as a new ones like ice-skating stadium (yes, the area is similar).
Hard for clear shooting, cause many tourists are walking around all the time.
Impressive square. Nicely done - not over the top like some monuments can be. The Square and the Millenial Monument is definitely worth a visit.

another very impressive square in Budapest. we past through it on the tour bus but didnt have time to get off and walk around...it is a beautiful space..would have loved to have explored it more but didnt have the time

Very romantic at winter. I was there with my husband in cold December day.. We had really great time around the square... The ice skating rink is so nice and the park behind the square is also a must!! Go for it and jump ( like me)
Large Beautiful statues. This is a large square where Hungary shows off its history. Several large, very nice sculptures. Good place to stretch the legs.

Beautiful site on a foggy day. When I was researching about Budapest, this place drew me in, under any circumstance I had decided to visit Heroes' Square. Initially I was disappointed that the weather was unpleasant and I wouldn't be able to see much, however the foggy and the mist gave me a memorable view of the square. This is a beautiful sight to see, however I would recommend that you go there with a tour guide as they fill you in with all the history behind each statue. We ears dropped in other people's tour and wished we had gone there with a guide. Nevertheless it's a beautiful place to visit with or with out a tour guide.

Great place to chill. The square is gorgeous, and you can take really nice pictures. When you cross the street and through the bridge, you can go into the City Park, which is a perfect place to have a relaxing walk

Beautiful. Lovely square, between two great museums.Its important to learn the history of the place before you get there.Its close to the city park, the baths, botanical gardens and zoo, and the Budapest circus, so if your in the area there are plenty of things to do.

Vast open space with lots of statues !. We had a look at this square when we were visiting the city park - its nice to see it but wouldnt go out of my way - we just spent a couple of minutes to take some pictures.
"Hero". Nice place to visit but nothing special, easy to get there by metro, behide hero sq.just 5 min walk have beautiful museum nice buliding and skating rink
interesting. this was approx. 15 minutes from where we were staying, very impressive place, not far from the winter palace and big ice ring.

Worth visiting . We visited Heroes Square on our way to the szechenyi baths. It's a significant place in Budapest as many important events have happened here and the statues commemorate important historical figures in Budapest. Try and visit here if you can.

Must visit . Large Square with open places ice rink not too far away great for taking photographs must visit when in Budapest very impressive place you can get there very easy by using the underground for only 80p a good day out

Exceptionally beautiful at night. Have been here before and it is always crowded with people, which is fine because it is a beautiful spot but i do suggest stopping by in the later evening, past 9pm if you want some beautiful photos without the people. It's well lit at night and just as magnificent
Great in the mist. Very interesting to visit in the mist. Many photos to be taken here. Be careful crossing roads as the drivers wont stop.

Larger than Life. We walked to Heroes' Square from the Marriott. A nice walk, looking at the city. The statues are large and beautiful. The area around the square is very big with other things going on (people painting, weddings, field trips). We enjoyed reading about Heroes' Square and the history.

Will need to have a tour guide to explain all the statues. It is a very wide area and with a lot of war heroes there. Hence you need to get a tour guide to explain the history to you. If you are going there in wintertime, you need to wear more to keep you warm.

Top. I recommend essential viewing and imaging, because it is really a monument of worldwide importance. On it are all important leaders and Kings, which are part of the history of the State of Hungary.

If you like statues. If you like statues then this is the place for you. It is set in a beautiful space and the statues are grand and impressive. If you don't like statues and big empty spaces then you should probably find a different place to go, and there are plenty other venues to visit in this breath taking city.

Impressive but kind of boring. Heroe's square at first sight is very impressive since the majestic statues and pillars mesmerise you but other than that there is nothing else it can offer. If you are lucky enough to visit it during the Christmas festive period, there are a number of stalls situated near it along with an ice skating rink.

Interesting and Beautiful Attraction. This monument was explained by our guide and it was really interesting and I think anyone visiting Budapest would certainly want to have it on their list of sites to visit.

Interesting Area with lots to do!. The square with unique, although a bit of reading should be done to understand history behind it.However the surrounding was beautiful, with a massive park behind the nearby castle as well as a huge ice-skating rink (Winter) and the Széchenyi Thermal Baths nearby. There is the Kunsthalle with exhibitions of contemporary art. Simply loaded with places to go, very recommended as a day trip.

Lots to see in the area. Although it was a very cold day, we walked around Heroe's Square. We did not see any of the museums but walked past the oldest Skating rink on to the castle, which was pretty. I assume in the summer the area is very enjoyable as there are trails and a fountain.We were told that the coffee was delicious at the cafe by the square, but it was closed to The public as there was a private party taking up the entire space :(

Cultural and historical place . The cultural memorial square is a must visit for all who come to Budapest. The statues and the sculptures of different heroes from the past shows the characters of this excellent race's struggle and success. It adds inspiration to the modern generation to aspire too.

An Iconic Square. Heroes' Square was a stop on our tour with our Viking Cruise Ship. The guide gave an excellent overview of the symbolism of the Square. The statues are of the Seven Chieftains of the Magyars and other important national leaders, as well as the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

Worth a look. We stooped off at Heroes' Square on our hop on hop off bus tour. It's a lovely place too see and take a few pictures but not somewhere to stay for too long as there isn't much to do there. Although the zoo and Lukacs Baths are just down the road. We seen the area for the ice rink and were disappointed it was not open yet as we'd love to have gone but it sadly it was only October and too early.
Wow!. This is an amazing place to visit when in Budapest. I would say it's a must-do. Not only is it part of the Hungarian history but also a beautiful place to take great pictures on a sunny day :)
History. This is history! You have to spend a morning in this place, fantastic monument of the god of war. It is a place full of history

You can see everything in a short drive. Hop on Hop off buses provide you access to this entire area of the Pest side of the city. The area around here provides interesting views of the Palace where no one lives, an artificial skating rink, the zoo and the bath area. Would have loved to try the bath spa!
Local Attraction. It was a very quite and big square, it was a nice walk through the square to the famous spa, also a art gallery on the corner.
Tourist attraction. We visited mid-december and were pleasantly surprised with how quiet it was. We managed to get good photos with no crowds or tourists

Hungarian history. After soaking in the Szechenyi Spa for an hour or so, we walked through Heroes' Square to our accommodation, after dark. The lighting on the statues made the place really special, and is a fitting tribute to the tribulations the Hungarian people have endured through history.
Large square to reflect. A large city square slightly outside the main town centre. Accessed by the hop-hop off buses. Plenty to see and do around tthe square

An imposing monument. The Heroes' Square monument is a 36-meter column capped by a statue of Archangel Gabriel.. On either side of the column, colonnades extend in a semi-circle, and between the individual pillars stand statues of former Hungarian rulers. Above the corner pillars are sculptures in bronze. In front of the Millennium Monument is the Unknown Soldier memorial. On either side of the square are Museum of Fine Arts buildings.

Good area of the city to spend a day.. A must place to see in Budapest. I would walk the Andrassy street from Deak Ferenc square to enjoy the view of the historical buildings and get to this statue park. There is not English explanation under the kings but still a nice place for some selfies. Szechenyi bath is a short walk from it. The varosliget Wil be under renovation and improvement so hoping to see way more recreational activities. Ice skating is popular and very close as well in the winter.
Worth seeing. Worth seeing as the monument itself is impressive, albeit not for too long, however the ice rink is adjacent at the moment and the ice rink is a must do!

Trafalgar Square, Hyde Park, Windsor Castle rolled into one!. A little out of town but a lovely walk of 20-30 minutes from the Danube up the beautiful Andrassy Ave. The park has a wonderful square, parkland with lakes, a fairy-tale castle and, in winter, a huge ice-skating rink. It will take about an hour to stroll around everything and take it all in. There is no charge and it is really pleasant just to soak up the beauty and the architecture. There is a restaurant/cafe and nearby is the wonderful Paprika restaurant. I'd recommend a mid-morning stroll followed by lunch at Paprika.
Iconic. Heroes Square is an iconic monument in Budapest, It is breathtaking viewing it from the walk up Andrassy Avenue. An absolute must see while in Budapest.

A ver beautiful square in Budapest. Is is a very large Square and is considered a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It was very nice to visit the square and its surroundings in New Years' Eve in January, with the Crhistmas Lights

Magnificent Square.. A very large open square with magnificent monuments to commemorate the fallen heroes of Hungarian history. One can take a long walk back along Andrassy Ut to the Danube River. The square is adjacent to parklands for a suitable rest.

Nothing special. I lived in Budapest for quite some time and never liked the heroes square. It is monumental and in my opinion not beautiful. Other than that, it is fairly off the center; so unless you plan to walk to the baths, or to the zoo, I see it as a waste of time.
Nice square. Beautiful architecture and monuments of Hungarian nation heroes. Central square close to Andrassy Street.

Spectacular testimony too the Czech culture and her war dead.. I was blown away by the massive simplicity of its very elaborate sculpture and architecture. The characters portrayed are both awesome and extremely inspiring. Kind of says it all regarding the local culture and history to many past wars and conquests. The only downside was watching a bunch of obviously non-Czech younger generation climbing all over the tomb and flaunting their "selfie sticks". Oh well, we have the same problem in the US

Imposing. Fabulous area of Pest , where the Guards stand over the atom. Of The a unknown Soldier steeped in history and surrounded by sons beautiful Greek looking buildings which where hone to Hungarian Treasures
Great statues. Visited here in December. Very cold but it all added to the atmosphere. The statues here are really impressive.
Looks great at night with the statue of Archangel Gabriel on it. Beware of pickpockets as had my wallet snatched from my back pocket accessing this site from the metro

Striking. What can you say about Heroes Square, in a way these memorials are common place across Europe but there is something unique about Heroes Square that I just could not put my finger on. Perhaps te sheer heroism exuding from the statues or the sheer scale of the surroundings. In a word I can only describe as WOW
Interesting. We were amazed at the lack of people, not a lot to see but interesting. We were there for the castle which is just behind it
Worth a visit. Well worth a look around. Whilst we were there there was a Christmas market near by and an ice rink behind the tourist centre.
Imposing history. This is a majestic place, where you feel really small. It's a must go, as it is probably the most important monument in Budapest.

Nice square for photo taking. We came here after dinner as its near the hotel we stay. I would say finally.. A time when this place is not so crowded. It's always full of tourist in the noon. A huge square with all the statue of heroes
Great views. There are 3 monuments in the area. This is very well maintained and all the national parades are held here.

Looked good from the bus. We were given a quick audio guide of the square as we drove around it on the bus. Didn't really do it justice as you need to get off to appreciate it. Luckily the bus stopped a few meters from the square. Be careful of the traffic around here as it's on an extremely busy road and used by bus company's a depot.

Monumental. A very large square at the north western end of the long Andrassy Streetwith an adjoining park.There are many impressive buildings, the Millennium Memorial and statues of the leaders of the seven tribes that founded Hungary in the 9th century and an immense column bearing the Angel Gabriel.

Stunning entrance to the park. Although definitely on the tourist trail, this square is enormous and it doesn't feel crowded. The statues, as with everywhere in Budapest, are stunning and lend a very classical style/feel to this important historic site.

Monumental former parade square. A vast space with column and structures holding statues of the Hungarian kings. Close to the City Park and fine art gallery (currently closed). Many people come to view what was the parade square in communist times.

Brilliant. This really is an impressive collection of monuments and sculptures, perfect for a sunny day and near a castle, public park and underground metro station. However, I couldn't find any nice restaurants near it.

Where heroes statue rise between pillars. There is not much to see at the square itself aside from the heroes statues and the obelisk but coming here also leads you to a cool city garden with pond and fountain, a palace, the skating rink, and a thermal bath facility.
Very large square. This square is enormous, surrounded by grand buildings, with a large statue in the middle. Also has a very large ice skating rink behind it in winter.
Symbol of Budapest. This square is alive, there is always a lot going on here. And there is a beautiful park and Castle behind it.
great place to visit. large walking area zoo just 2 mins across road bus/coach we walked took about 40 mins from centre interesting
Nice square in Budapest!. Nice square next to the famous Terms, accessibly with the metro 1. In winter there is a ice ring skate
If you want to see some impressive bronze works - stop here!. The history of Hungary is depicted here in the many statues and bronze works of the country's leaders over a large time period.
Nice square. Probably a must see when you visit Budapest, large square, well kept and lovely monuments, great photo opportunities

Very impressive!. Well worth a visit, there are lots of things to do in the near by park, and a couple of local eateries, for a good lunch I would recommend Robinsons. I wouldn't bother with the argricultural museum unless its something your particularly interested in!

the most spectacular square of the city. If there is only 5 things what you want to see in Budapest, make sure the Hero's square is on it! Why? -Easy to get there by M1 metro line-perfect place for making photographs (both daytime and at night) -stunning buildings, statues around-it does not cost you anything to look around-from here you can take a nice walk around the park called VárosligetIf you have more time or if it's cold outside worth to go inside the museums.
